Reviews.Title: “Great location...excellent hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Joseph A
Reviews.Content: Great location for this hotel...very clean - staff that was always kind and courteous to myself and family...near Metro, RER and within walking to most major attractions with lots of restaurants and shops nearby...corner room was on the 3rd floor over the street but it was quiet with the windows closed...WIFI was free and fast as promised...When I return to Paris, I'll be pleased to stay at this hotel again...

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice”
Reviews.Author: susanisk
Reviews.Content: Clean, safe, good location near Metro, RER and in walking distance to most touristy locations. Check in was easy. It was great coming back to the hotel late at night and being able to grab a crepe from one of the many vendors on the surrounding streets. Everyone knows ahead of time that the hotel is in one of the busiest tourist areas of the city, so it won't be too quiet at night, but with the windows closed and air conditioner on, we slept just fine. The beds were comfortable and the bedding was nice and clean (same goes for the bathroom towels). The only flaw I could really find I suppose was the fact that we were on the 6th floor and the elevator was broken and could only take us to the 5th. Not a huge deal, but it was a bit odd that we stayed for a week and it wasn't fixed during that time. I suppose could have requested a room on a lower floor, but since my travel companion and I are both able-bodied, I didn't bother. Plus, we had a corner, front-facing room, so the view was really nice. The wifi was free and fast, as promised. We didn't buy the breakfast because there are so many spots right downstairs that offer similar foods for less money, but I heard nothing but nice things about the hotel's breakfast service. The hotel was very clean, the maid was friendly and it was so clean that it SMELLED clean after she cleaned our room. A solid hotel choice for people visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good service”
Reviews.Author: Riflerangeblues
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my sister for a long weekend in December. The hotel's location is a winner - it's very easy to reach from the Eurostar terminal and couldn't be better for sightseeing without having to use the metro throughout our stay. We had a top floor corner room with brilliant views out over the Boulevard and river. It was pretty noisy on Saturday night, but we expected it to be in a older building in this location. The twin room was spacious by Paris standards, clean and comfortable. The staff were pleasant and friendly. We opted to eat breakfast elsewhere - and there's lots of choice. I would not heistate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Frank1957
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay. As is fairly typical on the continent the room was fairly small but, aside from the lack of tea making facilities (we brought our own travel kettle!), this Hotel was was ideal for a short break in Paris. Good wifi service was provided free and our rate included a decent buffet breakfast. Staff were very friendly and helpful. As I mentioned in the title the location is excellent. St Michel tube station is about 30-40 yards from the Hotel door (exit 2 is the one to use) and many major attractions (e.g. Louvre, Notre Dame, Arc de Triomphe) are within relatively easy walking distance. I would not hesitate to return to this Hotel on a future trip to France.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location.Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: val_mtl
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at Hôtel D'Albe by myself.I was looking for a nice and decent place,closely located to RER B.I found Hôtel D'Albe to be the perfect choice.My single room was spacious,with a double bed and plenty of pillows!My room was on the 6th floor,even thought it was on the street side,it was quiet.The view was awesome. The hôtel is 3min.walk from the subway/RER making it perfect for a CDG flight.Major attractions are easily walkable from the hôtel.. just follow the Seine and you'll end up at Notre-Dame,The Louvre etc. The hotel is surrended by shops,cafes and restaurants. I had a delicious Kebab/Frites at GYROS next door for dinner.I didn't take the breakfast at the hotel as i don't eat much in the morning.I went to La Boulangerie de Papa right next to the hotel instead and got myself a delicious almonds croissant & coffee for 4euro. (Continental breakfast at hotel is 7euro/Buffet is 12euro). I recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice place in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden Gem.”
Reviews.Author: 1939northeast
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best I have stayed at in Paris. Arrived at CDG travelled into Paris by RER to St michel-Notre Dame walked to the hotel about 40 metres wonderful. This hotel is situated in an area noted for bookshops and bookstalls along the Seine, it has lots of atmosphere with many restauranst, pavement cafes and wonderful atmosphere. The hotel is comfortable and quiet, The breakfast is very good with plenty of choice, rooms are of a good size and with views of the Seine and streetlife. This hotel is well situated for experiencing the thrill of visiting Paris and soaking up the true feeling of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: True_8
Reviews.Content: This small but neat hotel is just a step away from Saint Michael metro with a direct RER service to and from both airports and Gare Du Nord Eurostar train station. Upon arrival we were greeted by the receptionist, although we arrived 3 hours before the usual check in time, she managed to check us in early. The hotel is on the small side but the great location, modern and clean settings made up for it. From our balcony we could see the river Seine, the local area is a good place for food with plenty of small restaurants and French cafes. The rooms were very clean with the main amenities including a mini fridge, TV and bathroom essentials. The only downside was that our TV didn’t work and there was no tea and coffee making kit but this didn’t affect our overall trip. Our flights were in the evening but we had to check out at 11am, as the hotel does not have a late check out service, but did hold bags for us. Overall this is a well maintained hotel and again great location and at a reasonable price for central Paris. Would recommend for to anyone visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: MFAMILYLisbon
Reviews.Content: Small but cozy hotel in a lively area of Saint Michel, rive gauche. Only steps away from the subway and RER station. Ideal for a late arrival at Orly: just take the Orlyval train to Antony and the subway line RER B direction Charles de Gaulle. About 45 minutes later you are in bed at the hotel. The Seine River is steps away and you can´t miss seeing the Cathedral on the Ilê de la Cité to the right. From there it's a lovely stroll to the Hotel de Ville, the Place Igor Straviski and the Pompidou Museum and/or along the Rue de Rivoli up to the Louvre...the Champs Elisées, the Arc du Triomphe... The RER line at the same staion serves the Musée d'Orsay, the Eiffel Tower or if you want to travel further, Versailles. The room we got had a double bed and a single bed (ideal for our son), very comfortable and spotless. Very clean bathroom, totally new. The shower is perhaps the less positive point because it's open on one side and can get the floor a little wet, but not too much if one is careful. Besides the size of the bathroom is quite big for the usual standards. Good surprise. I was a bit afraid that it might be noisy due to the amount of restaurants and bars around, but it was quite sound proof. Reception staff were friendly and were nice to care for our luggage (free of charge) until late in the afternoon on day of departure. We did't have breakfast there. The choice of Cafés around the hotel is very wide and right next door there is the little great Boulangerie de Papa serving fresh croissants and all sorts of bread, sandwiches and cakes, fresh juices, coffee, teas etc etc. And you can eat in the esplanade outside (it's warmed up in the winter). All said, do reccommed and hope to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: exeter95
Reviews.Content: This is a great choice for a value hotel in a perfect location. I've stayed previously near Luxembourg Gardens, which are beautiful but in the winter staying in the more "happening" St. Germain is often better. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful (although they aren't terribly knowledgeable about the area...if you want that you'll have to stay at the George V where there is a concierge!). The rooms are small but the bathrooms are modern and the hotel itself is quiet (glazed windows for those of you familiar with Europe). There is an RER stop within walking distance, not to mention near many major sights like Notre Dame and Le Fontaine de Saint Michel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Loacation; Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: Euro_101
Reviews.Content: Well located to the metro. Direct from CDG airport on the RER. In the Latin Quarter, so there are lots of restaurants and shops nearby. This area sees a lot of action, so being our room was on the street side, it was a bit noisy. We were on the top floor too, so I imagine it would be even louder if you were lower down. Hotel was nice - rooms are small, and our toilet was separate from the shower, but this is typical in Paris. Room was clean, towels and sheets/pillowcases were clean. Good hotel in a nice location. Good bakery right next to the hotel. There is also a Monoprix (gorcery store) a couple blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding mid-range hotel in the heart of Paris.”
Reviews.Author: Rileys
Reviews.Content: We usually stay in 5 star hotels so it was with some trepidation that we booked the Albe .... but we were pleasantly surprised. Clean, central and very little to no noise we were genuinely impressed,

Reviews.Title: “What a great place”
Reviews.Author: p.m.s.norton
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in a triple room which was spacious for 3 ladies and being a corner room we could see over to the Seine. OK not riverside but nice all the same. Not at all noisy even being on the front of the hotel and had a lovely small balcony. We had not booked breakfast but when we realised that one cup of coffee was about E5.50 almost everywhere we decided that E7 for a basic but filling continental breakfast was really good value. I know that there is a Patisserie next door with coffee in paper cups and sitting outside which is OK later in the day and their baguettes were fab but so nice to have a leisurely breakfast. There was orange juice, tea, coffee and range of cereals, toast and pain au chocolat etc. For a bit more you could add eggs, ham etc. Staff were not over joyous and one in particular could benefit from a smile campaign but it did not spoil breakfast.Great base and do not miss a trip to Versailles it was amazing and again so easy to get to from RER close to hotel direct to Palace.Buy RER ticket in advance (E7) and do the organised tour which takes you to parts of the palace including the opera house that you cannot get to on a general ticket. You can then use this ticket to go around the rest of the palace so was great value for money. The tour was really really interesting and Versaille town is nice to eat in lovely shops and eating places in the town and the most amazing McCafe opposite the station which is a MacDonalds cafe selling the most delicious coffee and pastries. Split from the Happy Meal section and an ideal breakfast stop before the trip. The hotel were happy to store our bags on the last day and the reception staff were really helpful and can not understand other comments as they guided us around and even found train times for us. Nothing was too much trouble for them and we had not problem communicating. Ask to be directed to the most amazing coffee and ice cream parlour, right out of hotel and first left and 2/3 min walk on left side. They make ice creams in the shape of a flower with as many flavours as you want. Coffee was pretty good too. There are loads of meal offers in restaurants behind the hotel and away from the seine. Certainly a lot cheaper than those close to the metro. We would certainly use the hotel again as it offered good clean rooms, safe area and plenty eating options and direct link from Gare du Nord to Versailles and easy to connect with all attractions and we walked to the Louvre. Went on the Friday night as it is open until 10pm so no queue and no queue for the Mona Lisa either. Eurostar brilliant way to travel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location! Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Faye83
Reviews.Content: I have Just come back from a 3 night stay in Paris with my husband, we are in our 20's and this hotel was perfect for us in a perfect location. It was our first trip to Paris. The hotel is right next to the St Michel Notre Damn Station, we got a train direct from the airport, once you leave the station the hotel is right round the corner about 1 minute walk away. The Notre Damn Catherdral is 3 min Walk and the busy streets of the Latin Quarter surround this hotel. The rooms were modern and very comfortable. Staff very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was included in the price. Lovely little breakfast area serving fresh pastries and toast, eggs cereal. We walked from our hotel to all the main sights including The Eiffel Tower, The Louvre, The Ritz, The Charmps Elyeese and many other places. Plenty of Bars, Restaurants and shops outside the hotel, and I felt very safe walking around at night. Even when we arrived at 10pm the streets were still lively and we happily walked around until 11.30pm. Great for Couples and Familys of young and old. This location is ideal for anyone visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Raq108
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 1 night whilst in Paris for Business. This is not my first trip to Paris, but the location of this hotel was perfect. I had to only jump on the metro to get to the office whilst being able to wander around Paris in the evening. The welcome was fantastic with recommendations on where to eat, adn my room had 3 beds and 2 TV's. Very good quality for a 3*. 1 Small negative is that the room didn't appear to have aircon and it got very warm. There was an air con box but it provided only heating and fan. So slept with the window open which got a bit noisy when the refuse collectors came around 4am.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in great position”
Reviews.Author: rainbowmaya
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel D'Albe for 3 nights from October 28. We visit Paris fairly regularly but have never stayed anywhere more convenient. The hotel is literally right next door to St Michel metro station and only a short distance from St Michel Notre Dame RER station, which was very fortunate as 5 stations on LIne 4 (including St Michel) were closed for line maintenance during our stay. There is a wonderful patisserie immediately outside where you can buy breakfast (much better value than eating in the hotel). The rooms are modern, very clean and the hotel staff are extremely helpful. Notre Dame is on your doorstep and most of the famous landmarks within easy walking distance, while those that aren't are easily accessible via the Metro, either from St Michel or Cluny La Sorbonne, which is just down the road. Restaurants abound in the area. We stayed on the 1st floor and street noise wasn't really an issue (unless you have super-sensitive hearing). We found the room a bit warm, but this was probably our fault as we didn't put the temperature down enough. Would definitely come back to this hotel again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you can tolerate street noise”
Reviews.Author: gralence
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and enjoyed it. Location is really good. The hotel is modern, in good condition, and very clean. The staff is friendly. I like the room layout. They offer free internet. The hotel is close to the elevator for Saint Michele-Notre Dame RER station (corner od Quai Saint Michel and Rue Xavier Privas. New and not widely known entrance #6. It is so new that you cannot see it on Google street view yet). Supermarket is not far away (~300m, just follow Rue Sait-Andre des Arts, that continues to Rue de Buci, before the corner with Rue de Seine). The breakfast is unreasonably expensive at 11 euros. The pedestrian street (rue de La Harpe) can be noisy deep into the night due to people shouting, singing...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris location”
Reviews.Author: Coastalrider
Reviews.Content: Hotel Albe is situated just meters away from the St.Michel avenue in the Latin Quarter. Few minutes walk to Notre Dame, easy access to tube/train. Very clean and tidy rooms and excellent attitude and service at the reception. Rooms are fairly tight, a bit warm, beds are super - worth the money

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: tijanav
Reviews.Content: By pure chance (and some TripAdvisor research) we have chosen Albe Hotel as our base for the 5 day Paris trip. What a find! The location is right in the heart of everything, especially if you are not into metro/bus/taxi. Nestled in the most colourful part of central Paris, the Latin Quarter, it provides the unique experience if travelling to Paris for the first time. Saint Michel Boulevard is just around the corner (supermarket, shops), cute little places for spot of lunch or dinner everywhere around you. Notre Dame is 3 minutes walk away, the city island with a market just near the Notre Dame, and 3 more minutes of walkin - voila, you're at the famous Hotel de Ville, on Rue de Rivoli (shopping, Louvre, Musee d'Orsay, etc.) Since the Albe hotel is located just by the river, there is a convenient way to get to different city location cruising down the river Seine (look for Batobus stations). Back to the hotel - great location, very clean, friendly (English speaking) and helpful staff. We stayed in a triple room which was OK in size (concerning it is Paris, famous for tiny rooms), with three double-glazed french balcony windows (no street noise in the room). The breakfast was very satisfying, buffet style. Overall, Albe Hotel is a little gem and comes highly recommended! Will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lisa26186
Reviews.Content: My mum and i stayed at Hotel albe for 5 nights in September 2011. We caught the euro star from London to Paris and found it very easy to catch the metro from Gare du Nord to St Michel. The hotel is a 1 min walk from the metro station. It is in the food area of the latin quarter. There are so many eateries to choose from. The hotel was very modern, clean and comforatble. The staff speak excellent english and are very accomodating. They are also very helpful in booking any tours, shuttles to the airport and printing boarding passes. Our room was on the 1st floor. It was a lovely, clean room. It was very spacious for Paris as was the bathroom. The hotel is within walking distance to the Notre Dame, Louvre, Jardin de Luxembourg, FNAC, St Germain De pres and Pantheon. We did not have breakfast at the hotel but there is a fantastic bakery right next to the hotel if you choose not to have breakfast at the hotel. Although it can be very noisy on the streets at night, you could hardly hear any noise in your room.The hotel was the most expensive out of our whole european adventure but that is Paris for you. Hotel albe was in a great location. I would most definitely stay at this hotel again and i highly recommend it to others!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Francoise&David
Reviews.Content: The first thing to note is the very friendly and helpful staff. The room was a good size for Paris and the bathroom was surprisingly large, with a great shower. The breakfast was very good, and the location of the hotel is perfect. A very good choice!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little hotel”
Reviews.Author: GNC4850
Reviews.Content: The highest compliment is to say you would choose again - and we would! The location is about two minutes walking from the metro stop and you feel as if you are in the center of Paris. The room was small, clean and very comfortable with little street noise. We did not have A/C but it was not a problem. The breakfast was more than we expected and the staff was quite willing to help with questions. From this location, you can walk almost anywhere in Paris or take the metro right outside this hotel. We'd love to come back and when we do, we'll choose Hotel D'Albe again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, convenient Hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: josaja
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hotel D'Albe from the recommendations of friends who'd stayed there. We were in no way disappointed! From the moment we arrived, to when we left, we received excellent service from the pleasant and obliging staff, and enjoyed every moment of our stay. The Hotel is a charming old building, which has been extensively modernized, including an elevator. This is small but serviceable and certainly beats lugging cases up flights of narrow stairs. The room we were in was of adequate size, and had a separate toilet and bathroom, both of which were just large enough for their intended purposes. The bed was comfortable and the quality of linen and pillows excellent. We slept very well here, as the windows are double glazed and keep out street noise very effectively, even though you are right in the middle of a bustling, crowded area. The air conditioning is very effective in keeping the room cool, so you don't miss an open window. (The windows do open if you want some "atmosphere"!) Free Wi-Fi is provided and works well. The breakfast buffet selection is large and of high quality (this is France!), the dining room is large and charming, and the waitress friendly and helpful. We loved our stay here - it is so close to so many iconic Paris attractions and convenient to transport too. An ideal place to spend a memorable week or so in this wonderful city. We will happily choose to stay at Hotel D'Albe again!

Reviews.Title: “If You Want To Be Where The Action Is.....”
Reviews.Author: Parisbreakfast
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel in a great location, this is a good hotel to be in. It's an old hotel so don't expect much. But you just walk out of the hotel, and right outside in the street is a crepe open till the wee hours of the morning and people are lined up. If you can't sleep with noise, this isn't for you. Noise even puts me to sleep. I'm just one of those kinds of people. They wash and clean the streets at 2 or 3 a.m. You wake up and it's like nothing happened the night before. If it's your first time in Paris, you don't even have to take the bus. Just perfect location! You can walk to Notre Dame, Seine River, even the Louvre or the bus if you're not up to it. So much to discover here. It's really up to you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, top buzzy location, close to main attractions, big choice of dining close by.”
Reviews.Author: Michael S
Reviews.Content: Arrived CDG late PM from Manchester - 2 hours to eventually find the hotel. Lovely Mercedes hire car BUT the driver used his IPhone instead of MB fitted NAV to find the place! Once arrived we found the staff very obliging and the room (536) compact (Paris after all) but very clean and inviting. If not for our cases blocking the balcony door we could leave the double doors open to provide a delightful view of the Seine (pronounced SEN) from the narrow balcony. See photo. It was warm so the A/C was most appreciated. Our room was directly opposite the lift BUT due to super door insulation we didn't hear a sound. If memory serves me well this was a twin room. Very comfortable bed and pillows. If you want absolute quiet DO NOT stay in the Latin Quarter - stay near Etoile - quieter but not so interesting, especially at night. In San Michel there are many eateries and street musicians set up when the book store opposite closes. A beaut Italian trattoria is just down the street (lane). Our waiter was from Lake Garda in Lombardy. Pasta was excellent and the very delicate Tiramisu was to die for. DO NOT order capuccino in Paris - even at an Italian restaurant. Best deal is an Espresso with lait chaud or latte caldo on the side. The lady in the breakfast room at L'Hotel Albe can speak some English but pretends not. We quickly learned that our room number was Cinque-cent-trente-six (536). After that we enjoyed some trial French with mixed results. Get to know the reception staff - they are good value, good fun and most helpful. About 50 metres and you are at the Seine. Turn right - there is Notre Dame. Cross at the lights and join the OpenTop bus - great to get oriented if this is your first visit to Paris.. This is a top location.

Reviews.Title: “Best Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cathy S
Reviews.Content: We love it here! Im only now writing a review from our trip 5 years ago...and I'd return back. It's a corner boutique hotel that faces the river & is in the heart of the French quarters (?) and they're easy access to restuarants & little streets to take you shopping, too. The open tour bus stop is just down the street. Easy walking distance to Notre Dame. Pay for a 2-day open bus tour & take advantage of it's popular stops to Champs (?) - shopping like Rodeo Drive in Beverly Hills, the Arch, & Eifel Tower. Their morning breakfasts which is included with your stay is awesome & beats American hotel's continental breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: LovelyMe85
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel a couple of times. Once we discovered this hotel (some years ago) we never wanted to go anywhere else in Paris! This hotel is centrally located, in Cartier Latin, near the Notre Dame. There are a lot of restaurants, bars and tourist shops in the neighbourhood. The metro is just around the corner. The rooms are not very big, but large enough! The beds are comfortable (that's nice, because normally you walk a lot in Paris!) and the bathroom even has a bath! It was very clean and the breakfast is very good for a French hotel. The hotel has a mini-bar. The hotel is not ideal when you are in a wheelchair. There is a elevator, but it's very small. The breakfast area is only accessible by stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location, clean, english speaking”
Reviews.Author: DPBonfire
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here only one night, so take this review for what it's worth. However, we were greeted each time we came through the door and english was spoken well. The lobby was small but contemporary as were the rooms. Beware that the elevator is TINY, you would have to struggle to get 2 adults and 2 full sized suitcases on it. The location was the best thing about this hotel. It is literally 20 paces or so from the metro and it is nestled amongst a ton of cute cafes all along a pedestrian only cobblestone street. This is Paris, within a block of the hotel were probably 40-50 restaurants of all varieties, Greek, French, Indian, Crepery, Bakery, Italian, Sandwich shop, etc. Plus it's only a block from the Seine. The only drawback is that the breakfast wasn't free as I thought it was. However, when in Paris I was more than happy to find a local bakery for croissants and the like. I would stay here again as well as recommend it to friends and family. Oh, one last thing. It's a direct shot by RER to Gare du Nord, that was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Malaxx
Reviews.Content: Like all reviewers, I like this hotel very much. I spend a week in Paris every years with clients for Roland Garros and have never been disappointed so far. It is close to almost everything especially convenient for metro (3 metro stations within walking distance and that means access to all the major lines, especially from Chatelet les Halle although it is about 700 m away.

Reviews.Title: “Soooo Comfortable, Convenient & Friendly!!”
Reviews.Author: nrf
Reviews.Content: OMG - Where do I start! I spotted this hotel over a year ago and thought that even from the outside it looked crisp and clean. That was spot on. Little did we know the rooms would be so nice (we had room 427 with a balcony and a slight view of the Seine). The staff is so incredibly friendly, all amenities worked beautiully. Hotel is equipped with an elevator which is perfect for being on the 4th floor with all the luggage! And what a location! just a few steps from the St Micheal subway terminal (Line 4) with easy access everywhere. Just outside the hotel door is a selection of 50+ restaurants. The Louvre is a short subway ride away or a brief walk. In fact, we were easily able to walk from our hotel to Galleries Lafayette (great Shopping). Friendly, Clean and well-situated. What more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel, but they disappointed us this time.”
Reviews.Author: lindy0126
Reviews.Content: Large group. 3 rooms. Prepaid. When we arrived, we got 1 room we asked for-the other 2 were not what we paid for, and they wanted to give us breakfast to compensate. Still waiting for a promised refund. Location is great. People are wonderful. They just need to deliver what is booked on line on THEIR website.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Aussie40
Reviews.Content: this was in an excellent location right near the st michel train stop. Hotel was clean. Didn't eat breakfast there as there are so many other options. Would recommend on cleanliness modern rooms and location.

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected.. !!”
Reviews.Author: totesridic
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my 30th birthday. Had heard hotels is paris was small and pokey. I loved this hotel. The bathroom was massive - i could even to yoga in the bathroom. Amazing and stunning view.. very clean and friendly. Fantastic location!!

Reviews.Title: “we highly commend this hotel too”
Reviews.Author: veloiste
Reviews.Content: to our american readers - this is paris, so don't expect rooms the size of a football pitch! the hotel has clearly been refurbished recently, and very well done it is too. the rooms demand tidiness - i.e.don't try swinging a cat! - but they are clean and comfortable, the bathroom is cleverly designed given the size restrictions, and everything works, including the triple-glazing and a/c. it is particularly pleasing in this day and age that the big windows also open fully too, to allow plenty of fresh air when the outside noise of no importance. Close the windows, and silence is resumed. wi-fi is free (a number of smart hotels should take note!), and even if a bit temperamental, once the quirks of determining out how to connect to it, it works fine. And if you have problems, a trip down to reception and a chat with the friendly and helpful staff should sort you out. for no good reason, we didn't try the in-house breakfast. The immediate location is a bit scruffy (somewhat like Earls Court in that respect) but for visiting other sights, you'll find the hotel is within easy walk of the Louvre, Notre Dame, the Tuileries, Luxembourg Gardens (a delight) and a stack of fine restaurants to suit all pockets.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in the crown of Paris”
Reviews.Author: artisanuk
Reviews.Content: Very welcoming, room very clean and airy with adequate facilities and typical Parisienne rooftop views. We stayed 5 nights and the room was properly serviced, plus fresh towels daily. The location is excellent, at the heart of the vibrant Latin Quarter, and only a minute from La Seine, the Metro, buses and taxis. Continental breakfasts in a modern dining room were very good with unlimited drinks, croissants, cereals and fruit. The lift only takes 3 people but it's not a real problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: dkrmd1
Reviews.Content: Located right in the heart of the Latin Quarter, the staff at the Hotel Albe made our stay very special. From the moment we arrived (too early for checkin), they helped us store our luggage and expedited our rooms so we could catch a quick nap. They provided maps and directions and helped us at every turn. Rooms were clean and modern with everything we needed for our stay in Paris. Our teenage son and our mid-20s daughter/boyfriend were able to come and go as they pleased to enjoy the many activities occurring within blocks of our location. With cafes and restaurants only steps away, metro nearby, and only a short walk to Blvd St. Germain, this is the best of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Amazingly Quiet”
Reviews.Author: rlewisk
Reviews.Content: Approaching this hotel you realize that it is in a great central location but it is also in a very noisy and touristy spot. We were concerned that our room would be noisy but happily discovered that the double glazed windows really do work and we heard virtually no noise day or night. We had a triple room which was clean, modern and small, but not uncomfortably so. The bath was also clean and modern. Next to the St. Michel metro and RER and walking distance to many landmarks, we were very happy with our selection.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff had quirky but fun sense of humour, rooms very neatly done, tiny bathrooms, smelled of paint”
Reviews.Author: tompel
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel is very functional and delivers (very cheaply) good quality basic accommodation in central Paris – it is very cheap for what it provides. The rooms were quiet – once you had shut the double glazed windows – despite looking over a very busy and noisy pedestrianised area. HOwever the rooms smelled newly painted and it made it a bit unpleasant having to sleep with the windows shut. The rooms were neatly decorated and very clean, with just the basics in place i.e. TV, soap and shampoo, but no tea and coffee facilities, or moisturising things. The staff were funny and gently teased us about our poor French and our flapping about in the reception area – in a refreshingly nice way. The area itself is extremely touristy and a bit sleazy and as a group of women walking around at night we had several men following us and making cat-calls – which wasn’t very pleasant. However, you can leave the area in quickly if you want, and it is so close to other areas – it is a great location, despite the annoying men. Would I stay again – definitely, its cheap, friendly, central, nicely decorated and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location for the price”
Reviews.Author: travelnuts88
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd year staying at this hotel. The rooms have been upgraded, they're turning them into boutique hotel. The room though tight for 3 of us, it had an excellent view of the Seine river and St. Michel Blvd. This was our 1st time staying in the corner room with balcony, awesome view. The hotel rooms are above the boulangerie, so we'd wake up smelling fragrant breads and croissants. Restaurants are within steps of the hotel. I'd recommend the Grand Bistrost restaurant frequented by locals serving awesome food with very reasonable price until late night (we walked in some nights after 10:30pm). Notre Dame is a block away. The hotel is steps away from St Michel's Metro that connects you to all sorts of trains to different parts of Paris. If you're light sleepers, this hotel won't be your choice. This is the area frequented by both locals and tourists due to the restaurants & clubs open till wee hrs. The busy St.Michel blvd is steps away. The only concern is that we always had to leave our room key with the lobby staff when we're out & about. We didn't have to tell our names to get our key, just the room #. Not sure if the lobby staffs just recognized us or this is the practice. In either case, this lack of security concerns us. Excellent staffs throughout the reservation, during the stay and check out.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, staff very fiendly”
Reviews.Author: citytraveller59
Reviews.Content: Location is brilliant, beside metro etc. and very near Notre Dame. Having heard about small rooms in Paris, was delighted with size of our twin room, which was also very clean. The staff were very helpful, especially with computer when we were printing boarding passes. Will definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Central location for exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: CanarioViajero
Reviews.Content: The Albe is really good located. It is right next to the RER train station, so it is really handy when coming/going from/to the airport. You just get off the train, and the hotel is only 1 minute walking away. In addition, the most important sights are within walking distance. You are almost in the middle of the Quartier Latin, but then you have the Notre Dame almost in front, the Seine River, the Marais...location wise, the hotel is just perfect. The rooms are very small. However, this is standard in Paris, unless you are willing to pay a fortune for a hotel room. We got a room on the last floor, so we had a small balcony with great views of the river. Was great!! Another good thing is that there is free internet in the lobby, which is great for looking up information about the best restaurants and bars, or just getting your boarding cards. Finally, we did not have breakfast at the hotel, as we preferred going to typical cafés to interact with the locals...much more fun than having a standard breakfast at the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Location. Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: MalloSydney
Reviews.Content: The Albe was just fantastic value in a fantatsic location. You get a great Parisian feeling staying here and are in the heart of great restaurants and right near the Notre Dame. Service was fantatsic and nothign seemed too much to ask. The rooms are small but that is typical of many places in Paris. Having said that the room was well laid out and very modern, clean and quality fittings. Would absolutely recommend this to anyone looking to create a base for Paris sight seeing and will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly,clean hotel in top location”
Reviews.Author: jana50
Reviews.Content: I stayed only 2 nights in this hotel,when travelling with my sister, but we wished we could have stayed much longer. The staff spoke good English, were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was very generous for French standards. We did not have a problem with the noise, since it was snowing and we kept, double glazed windows closed , room was warm and inviting, bedding and bathroom spotless. I have recommended this hotel to all my friends and family, although not cheap, very worth the money

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: Bokaroo
Reviews.Content: Hotel Albe is situated a stone's throw from the St Michel metro stop in the heart of the Latin Quarter, my favourite part of the city. However, the fact that it's right in the middle of all the action means that if you open the windows in your room, you are subjected to a lot of noise from the cafes outside. This wouldn't be an issue if the air con was available year round - we went in November, but found the room was a bit too warm. However, if you open the windows, you're not likely to get much sleep due to the noise from outside. That aside, the hotel is decent enough. The breakfast is nothing special (in fact, I wouldn't recommend it) but the location and the price are both good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern rooms in a great location”
Reviews.Author: piggy99
Reviews.Content: The location can't get much better than this (downside is the noise factor), situated in the latin quarter very close to St Michel train and metro stop, with lots of food and drink options right on the doorstep. The hotel was being renovated at the time so the rooms were very new with a nice clean modern feel. With the window closed the noise was reduced somewhat and made it ok for sleeping, however we couldn't get the air conditioning working and the heaters were working overtime. Even though it was nearly wintertime, we were boiling hot in our room at night and it was too noisy to open the window... Despite the heating problems, i would highly recommend this hotel. Location is great, rooms were nice and the service was formal and polite. However if you are a light sleeper it'd be better in a different location (probably not in latin quarter).

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in a convenient location - but poor night's sleep.”
Reviews.Author: Jowie81
Reviews.Content: There are lots of positives about this hotel – but also a few negatives. It's in the buzzing Latin Quarter close to lots of restaurants and to Notre Dame. The decor is contemporary and the rooms are clean. Our small, modern bathroom also had both a bath and a shower which were spotless. The breakfast room is pleasant and looks out to the street. However, the breakfast area seemed rather too small for the amount of guests... we all seemed quite crushed when trying to get our food. The breakfast selection is pretty standard – toast, cereal, meats, cheese, eggs etc... We got an offer which included breakfast which was good value. I perhaps wouldn’t have bothered if I’d had to pay extra – as there are so many cafes in the surrounding area (in fact one right next door). My main gripe with hotel was the sleep quality. We overlooked the street and even with the windows closed it was very noisy (until very late). Also our room was quite small and so hot and stuffy I found it very uncomfortable. We couldn’t open the window due to noise levels but the air con system did not seem to make any difference. The beds were comfortable, but I didn’t sleep well due to these things. It’s a fairly good hotel, but a warmer welcome and cooler, quieter rooms would have made it much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice clean accomodation, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: tcass
Reviews.Content: We (Aussies) stayed 1O days, then 2 more on our return from Lyon, Nice, and Marseilles. The Hotel is located right next to the St Michel underground rail station, and this assisted in getting to the Metro and RER lines. Windows are double glazed and keep out most of the noise from the adjoining streets; this is a busy spot with restaurants all round. (Restaurant food quality however is a bit better a few blocks up on St Michel and St Germaine Blvd corner). The initial room was a little small, but OK for Paris. It was clean, newly renovated, tastefully decorated, and had a view of the Seine, so we were happy with our first stay. The bed was a good size and new. The room given to us on return was better and it was larger. Breakfast was included in our package and although a little plain by general Hotel standards, it was of good quality and sufficient for our needs. The attendant in the Breakfast room was very cheerful and helpful with all sorts of advice. She is a gem. Merci bocqu! In general we found the staff to be very helpful, especially 'Alexander' and the two ladies who rotate on reception duties. We were given assistance with our transfer bookings, details on getting around, and many other needs, but they are running a busy well occupied Hotel, so they were very much 'to the point' in discussions. We would stay again when back in Paris and met some others who have done that at the Albe for years. The only down side was that one has to surrender the room key on each trip out; this is a hassle when coming and going a lot as we did. Notwithstanding this the staff are quick in taking and returning the key even when busy. In summary, a good place to stay and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a vibrant location”
Reviews.Author: DelhiDip
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a triple room (family of three) for two nights and were pleasantly surprised by the size, given Europeans standards. The hotel is a standard 3 star but we found the finishes modern (renovated washrooms), trendy artwork throughout the hotel, and the beds very comfortable. We were in a corner room with 3 large windows overlooking the square, and above an artisanal bakery which made for very pleasant mornings with the smell of baguettes wafting in everyday. The location was great for easy access to the Metro and other sites (ie. Notre Dame). It is right in the middle of the very busy Latin Quarter making easy access to restaurants and the vibrant nightlife, but it can be very noisy at night. We enjoy watching the busy streetscape so this did not bother us, and with the windows closed, the noise level was not noticeable. The staff is distant, but helpful when approached with questions.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location but the most unhelpful staff EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: DuffBelfast
Reviews.Content: A group of friends and I stayed for 2 nights in the Albe in July, I have to say the location is first class and it's a nice hotel but...........................I really need to say something about how the staff treated us it was beyond a joke. After forgetting my room number I was told it was not the receptionists job to remember my room number!!!!!!!! Well what was his job then I dare to ask??? Apart from sitting up with a face like a wet weekend! I produced my ID and have an unusual name so I'm sure it wouldn't have been hard to find. On the day we were leaving a different receptionist annouced he was too busy to take payment and carried on moving paper around the desk as we stared in disbelief...................we were honestly afraid what the guy would do if we argued such was his attitude. I would not recommend this hotel for that reason alone as you might end up in jail after punching him. To enjoy Paris Avoid! Belfast girl. x

Reviews.Title: “Modern and clean rooms in a great location”
Reviews.Author: roxySydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel D'able for 4 days and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The rooms were recently renovated and all modern. The location is right in the heart of St Germain and is close to the Metro. The hotel offered free access to a laptop with internet access which came in very handy when booking tours. The only downside was breakfast was not included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in great Location”
Reviews.Author: jenny581
Reviews.Content: I cannot give enough praise for this hotel. It was fantastic - a real hidden gem right in the heart of it all. We had a room on 4th floor which had a partial view of the Seine. Room was quite large by Paris standards and the bathroom was pristine. Very modern in style - white crisp sheets. Hotel had free wifi - ask for a code at reception desk. Staff we excellent - offered us the use of an umbrella when it was pouring rain and also gave my husband a razor when he went to ask where the nearest shop was to buy one. Hotel is about 5 minutes walk from Notre Dame and area is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel let down by noise and current renovation work”
Reviews.Author: JakeFarnham
Reviews.Content: We booked for England v France six nations 3 months before arrival to insure good location and hotel. Although I recieved an email 2 days prior telling me due to renovation i was booked into another hotel 2 mins away which was annoying and disruptive repacking in mid trip and moving to Hotel Albe. Once at the Able the hotel it is well apppointed the rooms are excellent and the service cleadliness excelllent. Location excellent. But we had no hot water for a shower for which we recieved a 20% reduction and the location is very noisy singing outside from 3pm to 6.30pm. I would recommend this hotel but make sure the renovation work is complet.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but can be very noisy, especially during the "renovation"”
Reviews.Author: arlsLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel D'Albe based on the very positive reviews. Although the hotel is very centrally located & generally clean, there definitely is a lot of noise so would not recommend for any light sleepers! (And we were on the 5th Fl so I can only image the lower level rooms) Also, the hotel is currently going through a renovation so it was shortly before 8:30am when we thought the workers were going to hammer or drill straight through our hotel room wall. When we complained at the desk, the woman looked at us and basically shrugged her shoulders and told us there was nothing she could do. So if you are willing to put up with mediocre service as well as high noise levels, then this may be the place for you. But think we will look elsewhere for our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff.. a bit small though”
Reviews.Author: jacky_moo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my sister for 5 days and was impressed, the location was fabulous so close to everything and the unlimited choice of bars and restaurants were sublime, the staff were helpful even though i came in one night very very intoxicated they helped me up to my room which in hindsight i thought was a fantastic thing to do and shows their customer service is fantastic. My only problems with the hotel itself were a: the heat was up at a ridiculously high level (it was 36c in our room) we did end up shutting off the heat and opening the windows,b: the room was a lot smaller then i had thought and as this was a shopping trip storage space was not there at all,c: no gym facilities. otherwise a great place to stay. I will be returning but this time instead of a double will get a suite. Make sure you go to the bar opposite Notre dam and ask for a 'scorpion' this was recommended to me by the desk staff and it utterly made my trip to paris!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in an awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: amplexusomnium
Reviews.Content: Staff spoke english well and was very friendly. Booked a triple room (double and twin bed) and had to pay 30 euros extra each night because there is a safety law, one bed per person. Room and bathroom were very spacious. Yes it was noisy at night, but when things are closed in center city, the Latin Quarter is always open...with notre dame right there you don't need to leave! I recommend trying a different restaurant for dinner each night and definitely get crepres, chocolate bread, hot chocolate and gyros sometime in the quarter. The subway is right around the corner and links to the RER train station. Also close is the island st. louis which has unique restaurants and shops. Hotel let us keep luggage there until night time for our train after we checked out. They also had books on Paris in the lobby and you have to give them your key before you leave each time which is for safety. i would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “extremely clean, comfy beds and very polite and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: snowdrop025
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Albe hotel with my husband for 3 nights last weekend. It was exactly as I expected, as I had read the reviews people had previously written and I shall definately be returning.. For me the only downside is the fact that it is a bit noisy as people are having fun till the sun rises( well when it does).One can't really expect though to have everything nearby in the centre of Paris and have the peace of the countryside. it is a pedestrian zone though! It felt very safe at night, I wouldn't have been afraid alone. We got the RER B from cdg airport and arrived after 40 mins at the St Michel stop without having to change. and had a 1 min. walk to the hotel as it was 50mtrs away. We got a pretty good deal as we booked through an agency here in switzerland, and got 3 nights for 2, including breakfast. I think the hotel is worth the money even without the deal, as it really was very nice and modern ,the beds and pillow really comfy, it was spotlessly clean and there was a safe, and a minibar in the room, and the lady was very helpful at breakfast and was always keeping things in order and cleaning up after people.It would have been nice to have had different breads to choose from, but thats just a little niggle. I must agree with people who said that there wasn't much room to hang things as it would have been a bit problematic if we had stayed a week, but for a weekend it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean, comfortable, reasonable size room for city centre.”
Reviews.Author: Ruby0798
Reviews.Content: We used this as a base to see the main tourist attractions in Paris. Really central - you can walk to quite a few of the attractions if you want to but the main metro/RER station of St Michel/Notre Dame is also close by if you prefer to tube hop! Direct train from CDG airport straight into St Michel made transfer from and to the airport stress free. Plenty of cafes and places to eat in the streets immediately surrounding the hotel, although the service and value for money varied considerably. Boulongerie on the corner beside the hotel was lovely! Noise from the streets below was not too bad as the windows did block out quite a bit. Not sure what it would be like in the middle of summer. We would definitely use the hotel again and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to someone else. All in all a very enjoyable trip!

Reviews.Title: “Good but noisy location”
Reviews.Author: fatimaLuxembourg
Reviews.Content: This is an average hotel. The location is very good (just metres away from the metro) but it is not a quiet location at all! you are surrounded by thousands of tourists and the (sometimes not tasty) smell of the myriad of restaurands around. This is of course a personal opinion. The rooms are modern and clean but really small and smelly. The breakfast was good but nothing special. I'd say that it was a good choice but I would probably not choose it again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here for the LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Hiker100
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel for the perfect central location to most sites and especially the St. Michel Metro station which is literally right downstairs. St. Michel also goes straight to the CDG Airport. Very very convenient. Also very close to Notre Dame and Lourve. Paris is an expensive city. This hotel is moderate to expensive. I paid $160 Euros a night but you can find $140 Euro a night I believe if you book with them early through their website. I think its worth it for the location alone. Its not the cheapest place but I found but Paris is a city for walking and after a long day, you don't want to be walking far back to your hotel from the Metro station. This place is also conveniently located next to restaurants and cafes. It does get noisy at night so beware. The rooms are clean and modern but very small, as most Parisian rooms are I imagine. Simple but nothing fancy. Staff is helpful and professional. Don't eat at the hotel. There's a cafe downstairs that has great typical French breads, coffee, etc for breakfast. Wifi Internet - you have to pay extra. Approx 3 Euros/day, or 11 Euros/week I believe. Nice reliable connection.

Reviews.Title: “Just good location...”
Reviews.Author: MaraisLuisa
Reviews.Content: The good things about this hotel are: 1)Is close to the Louvre museum 15min walk 2)St Michel metro station is just outside the hotel 3)The room was clean But the bad things about this hotel are: 1)Too expensive 190euro for a double room.You could stay to a better hotel with these money 2)Impersonal service 3)The area is very touristic with low quality restaurants 4)Noisy specially weekends 5)You have to pay extra 11euro for a very poor breakfast.You can have a nice coffee and croissant in every corner of Paris 6)The rooms are really small and I would not describe the hotel as "a boutique hotel". BUT Paris is so beautiful!!!Is honestly the City of Light Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: goehringw
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris. The hotel was nicely decorated and furnished. The room was very clean. The staff was pleasant. With the windows open the room could be noisy but when closed it was very quiet. I liked the close proximity of the St. Michel Metro and RER stations which gave direct travel to the Gare de l'Est and Gare du Nord train stations and Charles de Gaulle airport and Chateau de Versailles. The Latin Quarter is nice for a first time visit to Paris as everything is so close. We used the Batobus for much of our transportation. It was slower than the Metro but much more relaxing and scenic. We went to all of the normal tourist sites. One of the best things we did was tour the Hotel National de Invalides which is a nice war museum and the burial place of Napoleon. If you are planning on going to alot of musems I would get a Museum Pass. The St. Germain area seems to be a little quieter and has alot of good restaurants so we ate dinner there some. The restaurant Vins de Terroirs was good. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: gtksxp
Reviews.Content: I cannot speak enough of the location of this charming little hotel. My experience at the Hotel D'Albe was very good, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choise in the middle of Paris!”
Reviews.Author: BirgitJ
Reviews.Content: Nice and helpful staff in the reception. The shower a bit small, but OK. Nice and tidy everywhere. Plenty to choose from in the breakfast room. The neighbourhood is a bit noisy, lots of bars and restaurants. I asked for a room high up, and I was not disturbed by the noise. But if you are a light sleeper I think you should get a room in a more quiet district. Metro and RER-station are very close.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Flip78
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night before going onto Italy. It was a great location, very close to the Metro station, lots of bars and restaurants in the Latin Quarter and very close Notre Dame. The staff were very friendly and helpful and gave us a good recommendation for dinner. The room was small as was the bathroom, but it is the centre of Paris so to be expected. It was very clean and quiet and the bed was comfy. Breakfast was ok but maybe a little lacking in choice. Overall it was a very nice hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “The special offer with breakfast made for a great mini-break!”
Reviews.Author: Vivamarverde
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfect for our mini-break (two friends travelling; first trip to Paris for one of us): excellent direct links to CDG and to Gare du Nord (for Eurostar back to London) and right in the corner of rue de a Huchette, off the Boul'Mich. Simple, clean lines make a very competent and unfussy restoration of an old building. Exactly what you want from a hotel: central location, good beds and soft bedlinen, MODERN (tiny, yes, but clean and functional) bathroom, enough wardrobe space (with big mirrors) for two people, flat telly and minibar (we didn't use the safe, but I think you need a special key). Beautiful full height window with an angled view of the Seine and a bit of the Louvre (room 429), above a very lively street. The double-glazing is PERFECT (no noise at all!). The aircon worked like a dream, was very quiet and SIMPLE to operate (you know, the "ON/OFF" button style and you could actually READ the display). Breafast was included in our special offer: delicious little croissants (we demolished quite a few), good coffee (don't believe everything you hear about bad French coffee) and chocolate, and the usual other bits and pieces: cheeses, ham, eggs (boil your own), sweet breads, butter and a good selection of jams. Some fresh fruit (not much of that, though). The breakfast room is tiny but very friendly (you always appreciate a warm smile for breakfast), with windows to the street. They serve it till 10.30 but there were notices around saying you could make arrangements for other times, or to have it in your room, if you needed it (early departures, lazy mornings). We may try it next time... The lift only takes three people (with a big suitcase you'll probably travel alone) and the corridors are extremely narrow but not oppressive (short and bright colours). The decor is simple and friendly. The old staircase is LOVELY. We DID use the Wi-Fi (5 euros for 48 hours). We had our Eee PC and it was great to show our room and the view to our families in the evening. Connection quality varied (good enough for surfing but not good enough for GOOD Skype video). We both thought Wi-Fi should be free. Just outside the hotel there are plenty of crêperies and tourist restaurants (very touristy and expensive: 5 euros for 250cl of water!). But the Italian ice-cream in "Amorino" (rue de la Huchette) is YUMMY!!! We saw little of the staff as we were out all day but when we did they were very courteous, competent and friendly. We will definitely use the Albe again, and we recommend it wholeheartedly: the PERFECT 3 stars!

Reviews.Title: “A great Bargain”
Reviews.Author: weintrw
Reviews.Content: We had three rooms for a week. Single, double, triple. All were small by American standards, but average for Paris. mIt's clean, modern, the bathrroms have "shelf" space. Flat TV is present. Very quiet except the single on the weekend heard the partying. The location is great. Metro is 100 feet. WiFi not free, but there is unlocked wifi from nearby in the lobby. The breakfast is not worth the price, so we went three paces next door to a great Pattisiery. 1.9 euros for coffee and croissant. $ euros for much more. Just no protein. The location locally is great. Dozens of places to eat on the block. The area is a step below fancy, but we loved it and the excitment of all the students, artists and musicians who hand there. We ranged in age from 7-70 and for the price it was perfect. In fact we passed many more expensive hotels where the location was no where near as enjoyable. This is three star. Staying at a four star got you nothing. A five star is different, but really added little to Paris but cost.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and cheap hotel in a terrific location”
Reviews.Author: Claire53
Reviews.Content: It is the 5th time I am in Paris and the 2nd time I am staying in the Albe Hotel. This time we were there for 8th nights, from Aug 20th to Aug 28th. I had reserved 2 standard rooms, one double for my husband and me and one single for my daughter. The double standard was a bit too small for 2 people, while the single was ok for one. Altogether we had space enough. The rooms were spotless and comfortable, nothing was missing for a nice stay. Also the staff at the reception is very nice and polite, always ready to help. Breakfast was not included in the price, but you could have it in a small room for an extra charge. I was happy it wasn't included, since we are late sleepers and it was over at 10:30, so we would have missed it all the time. All around in the area it is full of bars and cafés, so you can have it wherever you like. The best thing of this hotel is undoubtedly the location, just besides Notre Dame and the Ile de la Cité, so you can reach so many attractions just walking a little. Besides in front of it there are a Metro stop, a RER stop (coming from Roissy airport direct in half an hour) and a taxi stop with taxis always present. So what else can you ask? When we'll go back to Paris we will remember this nice, clean, little hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in an excellent location with touches of luxury”
Reviews.Author: MyleenAustin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located on a small street for experiencing the Parisien lifestyle. There are literally 100s of cafes within a 5 minute walk of the hotel, both expensive to cheap (the Latin Quarter is primarily a student area). Several Metro and RER lines are within a 1 minute walk. There is also a delightful bakery or "salon de the" right next door with the most buttery croissants I have ever tasted. You are very close to the Seine and Notre Dame and there are plenty of souvenir vendors nearby. It is centrally located to everything and walkable to most all monumental attractions. You cannot beat this location or ambience. Make sure you tell your taxi driver that "rue de La Harpe" is very close to the fountain of St. Michel. In regards to sound insulation, the area is lively at night, with gypsies and street performers playing on the weekends. However, we had absolutely no problem with noise. They use triple insulation glass on the windows, so we did sleep rather easily. The room size was small by American standards, but average for Paris hotels since it is built in centuries old buildings. The beds were firm and very comfortable. We got a triple bed room and it was quite modern and very clean with flatscreen cable TV and mini-bar/fridge. Internet was not free, so you had to pay for a day pass. But the best part was the shower!!!! It had a rainfall showerhead on the ceiling and was simply luxurious. It fit our needs well, so there are no complaints about the room. Breakfast was fantastic! If you can get it included in your room rate, you should definitely get it, as the croissants (plain and chocolate, yum!!), jams, ham/cheese and coffee/tea were delicious. There are eggs you can boil and cereals/yogurt as well. I wouldn't call this place cheap, but nothing in Paris is. You get a lot of value for the money if you can get a good deal at this place. The staff was pleasant, and we would definitely come here again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel D'Albe - what a gem in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: AussiejOy_9
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay with Hotel D'Albe, having stayed in the hotel 5 years ago. We chose it mainly for it's superb location and were pleasantly surprised to find that it's had a refurbishment since our last visit. We were on the 6th Floor and the room was reasonable size (remember, this is Paris) and the bathroom had undergone a complete makeover with a good size shower, lovely hot water and was of a decent size. The rooms and bathroom are scrupulously clean, beds have crisp fresh linen, there is an in-room safe, flat screen TV and plenty of storage space. The breakfast is good with a range of cereals, fresh and dried fruit, pastries, baguettes, rolls, eggs to boil, toast and a selection of cold meats and cheese. We found the front desk staff extremely friendly, knowledgable and helpful. We were invariably greeted with a smile and a friendly enquiry about our day each time we returned to the hotel. Internet was 7 euro for 3 days, which was good value compared to what was being charged in Switzerland. Location is right in the midst of restaurants so there are no shortage of menu choices. Try the fantastic Greek restaurant around the corner from the hotel for excellent value (16 euro per person for 3 courses) and great food! And yes, it can get busy and a little noisy on Friday and Saturday night,s but that's what happens in tourist locations in vibrant cities. It's not that noticeable that it should disturb you and it doesn't last much past midnight. The area is busy in the evening but safe, with local families as well as tourists coming out to restaurants to eat. The double glazed windows blocked all sound out for us. On warm summer evenings in Paris you'll probably be just arriving home yourself anyway! Oh - and if your budget allows, do the Seine Dinner Cruise - Premium Service menu. It was an experience to remember and the food and wine were first class. Thank you Hotel D'Albe for not disappointing us the second time around.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but very small rooms!”
Reviews.Author: lizzie561
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a great, central area of Paris- two blocks from Notre Dame. Great location, but the rooms are small. Stayed with my husband and 18 year old daughter in early June (special family trip to celebrate daughter's graduation and her heading off to college in the fall). We had requested a "triple" and when we got there we were given a very small room with two twin beds and a small cot for my daughter. Totally unacceptable based on their website pictures and descriptions of their rooms. I spoke with the desk person who was not very nice, but ended changing our room the following day to a larger one. Very dissapointed with the front desk's lack of friendliness and customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: DianaCO
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March as a surprise birthday present from my husband. It was a great choice. In an excellent location right opposite Notre Dame Cathedral. We have a very large room - think it was intended as a family room as it had a double and a single bed and 2 TVs! The lady on reception during our visit was so friendly and helpful. Didn't have breakfast in the hotel, but went to the cafe next door where they did a 'set breakfast ' of juice, croissant, coffee. You could buy this to take away and bring back to your room, which we did the first day. Gorgeous chocolate shop/cafe up the back lane; the thickest gooiest hot chocolate ever and delicious icecream - if you like chocolate in any shape or form this is not to be missed! Would definitely stay there again on our next trip to Paris and would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MichaelsMom07
Reviews.Content: What a find! Nice clean rooms in a GREAT location! Close to many restaurants, clubs, trains, and major attractions. Being an American I must admit that I was shocked by the small elevators (lifts) and the very NARROW hallways, but the room was spacious (enough for 2 adults, 1 senior citizen a two year old, 3 large suitcases and a stroller), modern, nice and very comfortable!! I will definatly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “The best located Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: cfcglen
Reviews.Content: Located very near to Notre Dame the Hotel in the centre of everything. RER and Metro lines withing 40yards of Hotel entrance. The hotel is excellent value for money & staff very helpful, all rooms are very clean with proper AC, flat screen TV's with plenty of channels. The rooms aren't the biggest ever, but hey this is central Paris, our room had a double & a single bed, bath with shower and glass screen. Room overlooked the busy street below rue de la Harpe, ther was some noise on Saturday night but we felt this just added to the atmosphere, it wasnt that loud and certainly nothing to stop you sleeping. You can walk to Notre Dame in 5mins, La Louvre in 10 mins, St Germain Des Pres in 5mins, Eiffel Tower 9 mins on RER C, 3 stops.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - very nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: jay946
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for those who just need a comfortable room. Recently refurbished with good bathrooms and rooms. Location is great for nightlife (literally all around the hotel), good double glazing making it quiet inside your room when you are ready to rest form the night atmosphere! Rooms are not spacious, but are very comfortable. Would recomend this. Free wirelss internet is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel in the Heart of the Latin District”
Reviews.Author: TLinATL
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel ALBE St Michel for 8 nights during the June Paris Air Show 2009. This was the perfect choice. First of all the location can't be beat: Very easy access to RER B & C and Metro Line 4. Getting to the Air Show was easy as RER B took me directly there with NO train changes. The entrance to the Metro/RER is about 100 feet from the door of the Hotel. In this area there are dozens and dozens, maybe hundreds of restaurants. Easy walks to Notre-Dame, Palais de Justice, Sainte-Chapelle, Musee Cluny, Luxenbourg Gardens, + many more. STAFF: They were all great! Very friendly and willing to speak english when needed. FOOD: The hotel had it's own little breakfast room that was very nice. It served the typical european breakfast. The coffee was outstanding as you might expect in Paris and the staff very attentive. The breakfast was only 13 euros, very reasonable for a nice sit-down meal with great coffee. ROOM: Again I was very pleased and although the rooms are a little small compared to USA standards, the quality of everything was very high. Much nicer than your average US chain hotel. Good beds and bedding. Good internet connectivity via WiFi. The windows were excellent and sealed out the noise from the streets virtually completely when closed (this is a very busy area with lots of street activity so this is a key feature). And MOST IMPORTANT for visiting in the summer, the AIR CONDITIONING was excellent! It worked well, was a built-in central unit with in room control (not a noisy window unit typical in many chain hotels). This was a huge plus for me because in Paris many of the small hotels don't have AC or there AC is fairly useless. My room had a tub & shower and the bath room was very high quality with great water pressure and instant hot water. Overall: I highly recommend this hotel and couldn't be happier with choosing it for an extended business stay. I really can't find anything that was wrong during my visit.

Reviews.Title: “As always nice”
Reviews.Author: loa380
Reviews.Content: This was my 12 time at the same hotel ;o) I always choose this hotel based on the live in the area. The hotel is in the middle of the Latin quarter but easily to access with the RER from the Airport (IF you arrive during rush hours do NOT take a taxi!) The hotel is a goods a good starting point for a weekend or a week in Paris The rooms are VERY small! But keep in mind that ALL rooms for this hotel class in Paris are small. That's just part of the charm. But they are clean and nicely kept. The bathrooms are above standard in Paris Breakfast is typical French but of good standard and the minibar OK. Staff is nice and welcoming. I needed a doctor last time and 1 hour after asking for one I was at my appointment just next door. Excellent service ;o) If you get a room to the street you have a nice view but the noise is quite high! I prefer a room to the courtyard because it very quiet (Not a nice view!!! But when spending a hole day in Paris you need your beauty sleep ;o)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel surrounded with that Paris livelyness”
Reviews.Author: Nelso
Reviews.Content: Our room was spacious enough for 2,our daughters room was also ok double glazing made it quiet even over looking the street,a short walk to Notre Dame and not much further to the Louvre,Expect to pay 7-9 euro's for a taxi to the Eiffel Tower or like us the Lido , a must see.We asked the day time receptionist(male) for a good Restaurant and it was surperb.Hotel breakfast is basic don't expect bacon and eggs but it does.The reception staff get better as you get to know them.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could want!”
Reviews.Author: thedailyguru
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for the night when i was visiting Paris for two days with a friend. Having never been to Paris before, I booked it largely on its high ratings on tripadvisor. I was not at all disappointed! It is located about 40 yards from the St. Michel Metro stop, and about the same distance from the river. The views are spectacular and the staff was very friendly. There is plenty of great food within walking distance, a few pubs, and many of the "touristy" attractions are within walking distance (The Louvre, Notre Dame, etc). When I return to Paris, I won't even think of staying anywhere else...

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: NY500
Reviews.Content: The best part about the hotel is it's location. It's around the corner from Notre Dame, 10 minute walk to the Louvre, and a 20 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. The metro station is also around the corner. The hotel itself is clean. There are no irons in the room, so you have to go to the basement to iron. We were told it was due to "security purposes". That seemed to be there reason for many things. I called a couple days in advance to confirm my reservation, but when I got there they had no record. They were able to call Orbitz and confirm I paid for a triple room. Since the triple room was not available we were given the Junior Suite. The room was very nice. I would definitely stay at the Albe Hotel the next time I visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghPapa_D
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Good rooms. Very modern. Great location. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: CFTMel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in January .It is in a fabulous location, walking distance to most of the sights. We were three adults and shared a triple corner room. By Paris standards the room was large with 2 balconies. The bathroom was decorated in black and white and very clean.The staff were friendly and helpful. Make -your -own soft or hard boiled eggs were the only cooked breakfast available, but the rest of the continental breakfast supplied was fresh and plentiful. I would definitely stay there again. ER Melbourne Australia

Reviews.Title: “Wish we would have know”
Reviews.Author: tsmomma
Reviews.Content: It would have been nice to know there was pretty major construction going on...we left a night early. Pretty big oversight on their part....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: londongrl329
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for a long weekend with some girlfriends and had the most amazing time. Room was definitely on the small side but was in a fantastic location and right around the corner from the Metro. This made it so easy to get around and to see all of the sights. Would absolutely recommend. We also got a great price by booking online with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BurntAustralia
Reviews.Content: I have just had 4 days with my adult family and found the location of D'Albe wonderful. 5 minutes walk to Notre Dame, metro only a few paces away and as many different types of restaurants you can imagine. Hotel is very clean and yes they do have a mini bar. Only problem is that the rooms are really on the very small size and the beds are hard. I have stayed in this hotel before and the corner rooms are of a good size, but the side rooms really only allow for one suitcase .

Reviews.Title: “Clean and central”
Reviews.Author: HampshireMary
Reviews.Content: Clean, well run hotel. However, we felt the room was overpriced as it was small and you could hear the lift albeit faintly. We originally had a room overlooking the street - which is far too noisy even with the double glazing and it was right next to the lift. Changed it to one at the back which was much better and enabled us to sleep OK. New Year prices were 200 Euros per night which was very steep given the busy location of the pedestrianized area around it. If you are looking for a more peaceful location - I suggest you look elsewhere. Plus points helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: ManWithSillyHat
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in the heart of Paris, close to Notre Dame and the Metro. modern interior, good decor and an excellent bathroom. i'd certainly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: travellinon46
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel DAlbe for several nights it is a great hotel in an excellent location. You are right next to the Seine and walking distance to many major sites, restaurants, bars, cafes and bakeries in abundance right outside the hotel door. There is a great atmosphere around St Michel and Latin Quarter/ St Germaine. Lots of help from the reception on places to eat and directions. The rooms were small but adequate and spotlessly clean. The breakfast room was really lovely and a very good selection. Would definitely stay here again.
