Reviews.Title: “Very Happy...”
Reviews.Author: Half-Irish
Reviews.Content: We showed up at 10 am thinking that we would just leave our bags and check in later. The man at the front desk was very nice, and we were able to check into our room that morning. All of the people at the front desk were considerate. The room was clean. We loved the balcony. The hotel is in a GREAT location! The metro station is just steps away from the hotel. The streets below are busy, so beware of the noise level at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: glenda18
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in the heart of the Latin Quarter and is close to all attractions. We walked to them all. The room was clean and was serviced everyday and meals were not a problem as you have about 100 places to choose from right at your door. Would certainly stay again

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice decor, hot water problems”
Reviews.Author: RobLutterworth
Reviews.Content: Good points: very very central location very nice decor (much better than many hotels I've stayed at in Paris) Breakfast was good enough (with English newspapers as well) Good rate via laterooms.com at 150Euro per night. Bad points: I was on the 6th floor and with the windows open it was noisy, but expect that for central Paris. No air-con. I suspect the rooms will be very hot in the summer. NO WATER in the morning!! This happened twice! Reception greeting on arrival - the guy behind the desk was very miserable. However, other receptionists were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, good value - unbeatable location!”
Reviews.Author: Daniel46
Reviews.Content: The location in the busy Latin Quarter is impressive - just 1 minute's walk from the Siene and the nearest metro. The hotel is smart, clean and professional. Room sizes are small, but not untypical for Paris. Good modern bathrooms and showers. No bath in my single room. For a budget hotel (I'm afraid that €150 a night is "budget" in Paris) it is fairly unbeatable. If you go for the more expensive rooms I expect you'll be on a higher floor, which I would recommend if you are sensitive to street noise - while the windows are modern and effective, hustle and bussle is all part of staying in the Latin Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Sensational Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: TheBrices
Reviews.Content: Our Paris stay at the Hotel D'Albe was the best 3 weeks of our lives. Other than the magnificent city itself, the Hotel D'Albe, its staff and location were the major contributors to this perfect experience. Manager Cyrille and her front desk staff (Cecile, Youri, Massi and of course, Alexander) were absolutely superb. They were very friendly, helpful and informative and by the time we had to leave, we felt we had made some Parisian friends. We stayed in corner rooms on the 6th floor (double) and the 4th floor (triple), with the delightful bonus of a glimpse of the Seine from our balconies. Both rooms were modern and bright and more than spacious enough for our needs. We enjoyed the fact that the surrounding area is vibrant and lively and had no problems with noise. The breakfast room, supervised by the wondeful Sanja, was excellent with plenty of food and drink choices to kick start our days of exploring the wonders of Paris. The hotel's location is ideal. The jewels of the Left Bank as well as the Notre Dame, the Louvre, Tuileries Gardens and so much more are all within an easy walk. If needed, the nearest Metro station is only 20 metres from the front door. Paris and the Hotel D'Albe gave us the experience of a lifetime

Reviews.Title: “thanks to tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: smoker060
Reviews.Content: Thanks to tripadvisor I had read many favourable reviews and was not disappointed. I booked this hotel directly to secure a smoking room as most booking agencies do not have this guarantee or indeed information. In all my online contact the reception staff were prompt and efficient and their English was excellent. The room was small but spotlessly clean and except for the air conditioning it was fine. It is noisey at night but if you have windows closed its ok. Unfortunately because the air con was so inefficient we had to leave window open. Only 1st floor has smoking rooms or would have booked better room on a higher floor with balcony but hey! you cant have everything.This was my 3rd visit to Paris and the location is the best. It is a lively and safe district and my daughter(39) and I(62) both enjoyed it. As other reviewers have said, the choice for dining, proximity to metro and other transport links, sightseeing buses and tourist hotspots is superb. I would also add for any smokers the smoking ban in indoor public places has little effect on the tourist or locals when choosing a restaurant. The facilities for terrace drinking and dining in all of Paris is as always, wonderful. Most establishments have many tables outside for smokers with loads of patio heaters, and inside for people who do not like it, with no feeling of discrimination for the smoker. Unlike the UK where there is attitude even outdoors. Go to Paris and experience the difference. Viv la France.

Reviews.Title: “Loved teh hotel d'Albe”
Reviews.Author: noosabird
Reviews.Content: A small hotel right in the middle of the action in Paris's Latin Quarter. (excellent location). A good fun district, and within walking distance of many major attractions. Some rooms are very small but we were fortunate to get a small so-called 'suite' with room for three (with only two staying). Corridors were amazingly narrow. Beds were very comfortable, and the windows double glazed, mainly for soundproofing from the people crowded streets below. Breakfast dining room not recommended, and it was more fun to eat at the pattisserie right next door. The man on the front desk was very helpful, but a female person was not so good. Recommeded. Geoff H , Noosa, Australia

Reviews.Title: “No Eurostar bad luck not my problem”
Reviews.Author: AussieBattlepig
Reviews.Content: The staff and management of this hotel would not attempt to help my wife and I in any particular way. We were stranded due to a fire in the Euro tunnel and with no flights available and all car ferrys to the continent fully booked we were stuck in England. We spoke to the Duty Manager to inform her of our situation and were told that it was not their problem and we would be paying in full for a room we could not use but could be resold.We have also sent several e-mails to the General Manager none of which have been replied to. We would've gladly stayed on another date had this been offered.I dare say that after this review we will receive an e-mail from the G.M with an offer to stay but unfortunately it will be too little too late. As I am a concierge in one of londons top hotels and I know what good service is I will not be staying in this hotel in the future and will not be recommending this hotel to my guests or fellow concierge in London.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: ewitt2
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. It was centrally located and extremely clean. The room was small - but that is to be expected in Europe. What the room lacked in size, it made up in character, cleanliness and recent renovations. The staff was nice as well. For what we paid - you cannot beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel D'Albe St Michel”
Reviews.Author: rjack68
Reviews.Content: This is a excellent little hotel with a fantastic staff right in the heart of of it all. I hesitate in writing this as I am not sure I want the secret to get out!! Walking distance to everything. There must be 40 restaurants within 500 meters. There is a bakery right next door with great coffee. I can highly recomend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Smart clean hotel bang in centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: BobandGina
Reviews.Content: We liked this smart, clean hotel, with friendly, helpful staff. Modern f & f which was nice. Walking distance to everywhere: Louvre, Musee d'Orsay, Notre-Dame, and on the RER train from airport. Dozens of restaurants on doorstep, but most had similar cheap-o menus.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of this hotel's cancellation policy !”
Reviews.Author: MusicianEngland
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were due to stay at this hotel for three days in September, at the end of a tour of Brittany. Whilst in Brittany, my wife got the news that her mum was about to pass away, and we had to cancel our Paris visit and return to England urgently. We phoned the Albe FOUR CLEAR DAYS before our scheduled arrival, to regretfully cancel the booking, and we told them of the circumstances. The employee who took the call said that as we didn't have access to e-mail in Brittany, the cancellation was noted, and a refund of our deposit would be no problem. Following the death and funeral of our mother, we asked the Albe by what means they would refund our €180 deposit. They were totally adamant that there would be no refund, and I can't now persuade them otherwise. Needless to say, we won't be going there at any time in the future. There are plenty of efficient and friendly hotels in the wonderful Latin quarter, but this doesn't appear to be one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Albe with atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneJaycee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Albe on the recommendation of our neighbours who had been to Paris the year before. The Hotel is centrally located in the Latin qtr of Paris a couple of stone throws from Notre Dame and within walking distance of most of Paris's attractions & right next door to the Metro and Taxi stands. The rooms are small but very clean, and ours came with with a good sized double bed, two pillows each (unusual) a safe for valuables and a bar fridge with drinks at a reasonable price. The bathroom seemed new and clean. The room was serviced quite well each day and had a small balcony overlooking the Rue de la harpe....a very busy and soon to found out to be noisey location of Paris's latin qtr. The hotel reception area were very help in our enquiries and could speak very good english and made several suggestions about tours and visits, all of which turned out to be quite good.k Break fast was provided for 10 euros each was typical of continental meals served in a clean and modern cafe style dining room with friendly staff. You only had to walk outside the front of the Hotel to find an abundance of restaurants, either eat in or takeaway, with a variety of food from Japanese, Greek (seems to be popular in this part of Paris), Lebanese and traditional French cuisine. Only complaint was the noise generated outside the Hotel of an evening where street buskers & rap dancers performed almost each evening to load music. Even though we were on the 5th floor it was most noticeable of an evening. Worst still was the bars just around the corner opened to 5am in the morning that attracted a number of young revellers who thought they could sing at 4.30am in the morning. Every morning at 6.30am the local rubbish collection is made outside in the streets which at times woke us up. The pluses were its location, cleaniness and modern facilities, versus getting a good nights sleep. Would recommend anyone staying there to get an inside room away from the street front. Also thought the tariff was a little high though you do pay for location and being right in the middle of everything. Overall happy with the Hotel and wud recommend it to anyone who can stand the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved our stay at the D'albe”
Reviews.Author: bam_g
Reviews.Content: It's been a year since we stayed but (as we plan our next trip) the memory is still one of a great stay and a great hotel to which we would readily return. When people say its close to Notre Dame - look at my pictures - the location is perfect. It really gave us the feeling of being in Paris - as others reassurred you about soundproofed windows, we opened them wide to take in the buzz of the life in the Latin quarter. Rather than have breakfast at the hotel itself, we bought croissants , pain du chocolat and espresso at the bakery adjoining the hotel and enjoyed this in our room. Mentioning Tripadvisor never goes astray as we were upgraded to the corner suite with a balcony with views to St Michel square and the Seine . The location was close to everything with all transport options both to the airport and around Paris (bus,boat,train,metro) right at the door. The room had enough atmosphere to "feel like Paris"; the staff were friendly and helpful (only needing half an hour to prepare the room for early checkin despite us having arrived on a 7.00 am fight from Australia - the half hour was enough time to get a first take on Notre Dame). Some have commented on the lift being small - for us this was part of the charm together with the staircase. We read hundreds of reviews on the Paris hotels before picking the D'albe and are most satisfied with the choice. P.S. to the folks (and members) at Tripadvisor - well done - we also booked hotels at Lugano and Hong Kong after referring to tripadvisor reviews and both were superb.

Reviews.Title: “Htel D'Albe is a mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: Scanyou
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, but is under construction and there was much pounding. The rooms are very small and cost more than many hotels that include breakfast (it was not included). Some of the staff were somewhat condescending and not helpful. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Capper_1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Albe from July 14th to the 20th. It's in a fantastic location, the staff are amazing and the rooms are very clean. The hotel is right next to the metro and RER - could not have asked for a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “For Paris, pretty good!!”
Reviews.Author: aussieeuro27
Reviews.Content: The plus things for this place is one its location, two its price (for Paris that is), three its decor (modern-ish) and four, its house keeping staff! These people worked miracles. The down side was the annoying security measure of leaving keys at the desk on entering and leaving, the room was smaller then expected, and the price (damn Paris is expensive)!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Bumpking
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back. Friends had booked this hotel for location. I can honestly say I will go back to this hotel every time I go back to Paris. The room we had was more than adequate good size and very clean. Staff were very helpful. Full marks.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: ClevelandKat
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Paris. The hotel was in a great location with a taxi stand, metro, and RER stations plus the Seine and Notre Dame right around the corner. The decor was tasteful and everything was clean and fresh plus the beds were comfortable - and best of all for the warm days we were there - the air conditioning works very well! The hotel exceeded my expectations, especially for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Oh La La!”
Reviews.Author: Tykeinred
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a superb position in centre of Paris. Room was modern and clean, Breakfast more than adequate. I have used the hotel before and will continue to do so in future.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location for first time in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Ksep
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Albe Hotel for our recent first time trip to Paris. We had about 5 days to explore the city. We are urban dwellers in our early 30's and our trip goal was to experience urban life in Paris while putting 10,000 miles on our shoes during our short trip. A friend of a friend that has stayed in Paris multiple times and always stays at the Albe recommended the Albe to me. In general, I think it is the absolute ideal location for our needs. As I stated, this was our first time in Paris and the central location could not be better. I tend to obsessively research hotels before I travel and the location relative to the "must see" sites in Paris is what attracted me to Albe. The Albe is literally just steps into the left bank south of the Ile de la Cite. We saw all of the sites that we could comfortably see in Paris without ever using a cab. We walked and used the metro (subway) for all of our travel. During a random early morning jog I found myself in awe while running through the courtyard in the Louvre at the 7-minute mark. The hotel is on the corner of 2 small streets with lots of foot traffic and is just a block down from a major city street. The streets below the hotel are filled with some small restaurants with pizza, the ubiquitous gyro wraps, Greek fare, etc. There is a great little place just below the hotel, which has nice croissants, pastries, etc., for a French style breakfast. The street below is also "home field" for the local break dancing crews and random singing groups. Because of this, we could hear some classic 80's breakdancing hits at times during our evening naps. This was mostly nostalgic and entertaining. It was not an actual disturbance for us. The quality of the breakdancing was questionable, but I guess that is for another review. I will try to stay focused here. The hotel decor is modern. The elevator is probably the smallest that I have ever been in, but, like the breakdancers, it was more entertaining than problematic. We stayed in room 640 on the 6th floor. The room was small, but I knew this prior to coming and this was not a problem at all. There is room for the bed, small desk, small wet bar, and TV. There are no drawers, but the closet has shelves for your clothes. The bathroom was adequate size and has a shower with a tub. The hotel staff was always cordial, respectful, and helpful. I would stay here again, if I went back to Paris and wanted an ideally, centrally located, clean place to lay my head in between adventures

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Leila007
Reviews.Content: Myself and my parents stayed at this hotel near the end of April. We only had a short time in Paris so wanted somewhere central where we could see all the sites in a short space of time. The location was brilliant. It was right next to the River Seine and within walking distance of the Notre Dame, Lourve etc. We hardly had to even get a Metro pass for our time there. The hotel itself was really nice. The rooms were small, but good size for a central Paris Hotel. The room and the bathroom were very clean. The shower was powerful and the beds comfy!!! The reception staff were very friendly and helpful with all our questions. The hotel is also next to loads of restaurants so the only problem at dinner was deciding which of the many to go to! We paid for the breakfast there and was pretty standard but worth it for the convience. This was the thrid time I have been to Paris and it was definalty the best place I have stayed so far.

Reviews.Title: “Paris in the Spring!!!”
Reviews.Author: ks3841
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful week in Paris. 17 - 24/5/08. Hotel D'Albe - superb!! So central - walking distance from Notre Dame, La Conciergerie, Saint Chapelle, Sorbonne, Pantheon, Boulevard St Michel etc... The staff were extremely efficient and friendly, especially Cecile and Alexandrou. We unfortunately lost our camera, and the staff did their utmost to help us retrieve it. Rooms compact, but so clean. Beds and towels changed every day, and room fully cleaned daily. Lively nightlife outside, but we heard nothing when we closed the double glazed windows and put on air con. Breakfast in hotel was fine, but the weather was so lovely and there are just so many eateries close by, that we has breakfast alfresco most days- omelette du fromage, fresh juice and bread, croissants, cafe au lait- delicious!! We found a Monoprix supermarket on Boulevard St Michel - excellent French Merlot, under 3 euros - made a very welcome nightcap!! You most definitely will not be disappointed by Hotel D'Albe, and we intend to return on our next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rbach
Reviews.Content: Great location. Take the train from CDG exit at St. Michael / Notre Dame and you are less than 2 blocks from the hotel and in the middle of a great pedestrian area! There must be 50 different cafes, brasseries, bars, and take-away food vendors within 4 or 5 blocks. The area is loud at night and I did have a little bit of noise in the room, but not enough to make a rough night’s sleep. If you are really sensitive you may want to bring along some ear plugs. On the plus side the area is loud at night and there is lots of activity / fun. The rooms are average size (small) for a large European city. But there is plenty of storage and the bathrooms are very clean and modern. We did not try the breakfast at the hotel. There is an artesian bakery attached to the hotel and you can get a coffee and a croissant for much less. The staff at the hotel were nice when we approached them, but they did not go out of their way to say “bonjour” or greet you in any way. I would definitely stay there again simply due to the cleanliness, the price, and the great location!

Reviews.Title: “albe treasure”
Reviews.Author: gazzaParis
Reviews.Content: First stay at albe was fantastic,we arrived off our flight at the hotel at 9.00am in the morning from australia and the young lady was most understanding and checked us immediatley into a lovely top floor corner triple room which overlooked the front street.We came back to this hotel after ' weeks of travelling and although the room was not as nice as our first stay it was by no means a disappointment. For travellers looking for value for money with the comforts of a very nice clean hotel and a perfect location and nice staff this is one hotel we can fully recommend after staying in a lot of hotels in paris over 4 stays in Paris over 2 years.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean and well run”
Reviews.Author: Egbert_B
Reviews.Content: D’Albe Hotel is in a great position, no doubt about it. Yards from the Seine, yards from the St Michel Metro/RER, and thus directly linked to Paris CDG airport, surrounded by eateries of all standards and prices, its location is hard to beat. We stayed for 4 nights, including a weekend, and were fortunate enough to get a fifth floor room, with a small balcony no less, which afforded us an unexpected view across the river to the Louvre. The room was very small indeed, not unfamiliar in Paris, but fully equipped and decorated to a high standard in modern style. I wouldn’t want to stay in a room that size for a fortnight, but if you go to Paris for a weekend and spend so much time in your hotel room that you are worried by its dimensions, then frankly you need to get out more. The bathroom was a very comfortable size and again well equipped. Everything was spotlessly clean and in fully working order. With regards to the issue of street noise – no problem for us. Excellent double glazing plus our high floor kept out just about all of the noise. It really was astonishingly quiet. I note differences of opinion on the level of noise in other reviews, for which I have a theory. D’Albe is on the corner of two streets, Rue de la Harpe and (I think) Rue Hachette, in a typically triangular Parisien building. The former street is relatively quiet, whereas the latter is lined with restaurants of the noisy persuasion. If you end up with room on a low floor over the noisy street, you might be in trouble, however good the double glazing. On the other hand, Rue de la Harpe is just sheltered enough to preserve the rooms from the noise. I understand that all rooms bar some singles face one of these two roads. We were lucky, and therefore it was blissfully quiet for the middle of Paris. We didn’t do breakfast in the hotel: it’s expensive, and you can get fresh and excellent petit dejeuner at the Restaurant Saint Severin opposite the hotel for far less (and sit outside to boot). Alternatively, if you are off to the Louvre or the Orsay for opening time, try the wonderful La Fregate on the corner of Rue du Bac directly over the river from the Louvre for some proper Paris style. Note that prices in general in Paris now are sky high, especially when coupled with a nasty sterling to Euro rate. It’s pretty easy to blow 50-100 Euro on dinner, even without wine. Overall, Paris remains wonderful, and we had absolutely no issues with the hotel. Just ask for a high floor, de la Harpe side.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!!”
Reviews.Author: AmericansInParis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Albe for over a week and the location is amazing. A little below what we Americans over 50 years old think of as a 3 star hotel, but the staff were really great (good English), breakfast was good @ $10 Euro, room was very clean and the bathroom roomy and comfy. Room was a bit small but we are from San Francisco and the rooms are small here. I would go back to this hotel in a heartbeat. Let me make a small but very important note. We booked a taxi to Gare du Nord for the Chunnel to London. We were cutting it a bit close but the taxi was on time so we got there with no problem. EXCEPT we left my handbag in the taxi! I called the Hotel and explained the situation. They contacted the Taxi company and the driver. He returned the bag to the hotel and the hotel shipped it to us. We didn't lose the camera with our 568 pictures, a full record of our trip. I could replace everything but those pictures. m & r

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: egrl2444
Reviews.Content: Front desk people are excellent and speak many different languages. Rooms cozy and clean. Great location in the Latin Quarter. The neighborhood has restaurants and taverns galore...some at fairly reasonable prices, so you can easily pop in after a long day of sightseeing. And you are literally one block away from taking a train, subway or bus anywhere in the city and beyond. Would recommend, even though at times, noise from the street did drift in a bit, and the beds were a bit narrow, but that's just an aside for those who care. Enjoy Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: MelbinLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Albe for two nights with a room on the 4th floor. The room was very clean and modern but quite stuffy (despite turning off all heating appliances). We could not open the window due to street noise, which we could still hear despite the double glazing. Breakfast was quite good (continental with boiled eggs) although could be very busy. No problems with reception but annoying that there was no secure area for luggage (our bags were stored in a corner of the main entrance). Very good price and convenient location but I probably wouldn't choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: binote
Reviews.Content: The Albe is very conveniently situated, whether you come by train or plane via CDG or Orly, in the liveliest part of the Quartier Latin. Rooms are small but very nicely decorated. Staff is extemely friendly, in particular the breakfast lady. Rates are quite acceptable. Some clients seem to complain about the noise but we did not notice it, thanks to the double glazing ... and the fact that it was too cold to open the window. I have been in many hotels in Paris and this one is on the top of my list for price/quality.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: blitzin
Reviews.Content: Booked through Venere. We just got back (yesterday) from an 8 night stay at the Hotel Albe in Paris, France. Our family of 5 stayed in 2 rooms, one double, one triple (rooms 213 and 212 respectively). (Ps, I'm pretty sure the hotel reads these reviews: somebody earlier here had complained about being ripped off saying it had to be a maid with a key - one thing we noticed was *the doors do not latch* if you just let them close, you have to pull them (if inside) or push them (if outside) the room. Because our kids were going from room to room alot, we left our door -not latched- more than once and more than once a manager or staffer pulled the door shut to latch it, so maybe they saw the complaint here and are sensitive to it). The hotel is in an excellent location, especially given that you're something like a hundred feet from the front door to the St.Michel metro stop. (Of course, what nobody will tell you but I will - once you're underground you may have to walk and walk and walk to get to the train platform, but thats "to be expected". [?] Anyway...) Great location. Loads of greek restaurants in the neighborhood but a few french restaurants, a couple night clubs, a couple bakerys, a couple crepe places all within a block in either direction. Pharmacy close by also. Great landmarks within easy to moderate walks, greater landmarks and venues simple enough to reach by Metro. (and yes, we got an "orange cards" for each member of the family for unlimited metro travel all week and recouped multiple times over the cost over what single or carnet metro prices would have been). Of course, Notre Dame is an easy (EASY) walk. (I walked over there three or four times just on a lark while my family rested from me running them all over the rest of Paris). Ok, back to the hotel, not an overwhelming number of rooms, but the place was really booked while we were there since it was Easter - the standard Euro breakfast buffet was pretty crowded most of the mornings we stayed at the hotel (included in the room rate). (Breakfast could have been improved a wee bit, but we ate there every morning and can't really complain since it was "free".) Ok, one observation: alot (ALOT) of people staying there were French, hear what I'm saying? It's like your grandad always used to say on those long car trips about restaurants, "well, if the truckers eat there, it most be good!" - so I figured the hotel has a good reputation among the out of towners coming into the big city for the holiday. Narrow staircase (see pic) but not terrible to go up and down on. The -only- negative thing I can say about the hotel is that the elevator was being serviced at least 3 of the days while we were there - -however - the hotel always had the elevator running by dinner time (and all night), then they worked more on it the next day. So, no major problem. This is a 3 star hotel with three star performance. It was very clean and modern feel to it without being over the top "nouveau" feeling (like they were trying too hard - the feel of the hotel (to us) was just right). Front desk staff ranged from very fluent english to pretty good kinda sorta english. Cleaning staff was more ala francaise. Morning breakfast was administered by mostly one young lady who was very friendly and between her english (better than my french) and my frenglish, we got along famously. Side note: memorize a few french phrases and you'll open all kinds of smiles. Noise has been raised here a few times - there *are* two competing dance crews working the corner right outside the door (see the pic of a typical evening). But - we were on the 2nd foor, not the top floor, and nobody in our family complained to me at all, and with the windows closed I was barely aware of the noise and it certainly didn't keep any of us from sleeping. Would we recommend? Absolutely. Stay again? More than likely except that I'd like to try staying in another area just to try it sometime. The location here is fantastic. I won't belabor the review with anecdotes about the restaurants on the street (Rue de la Harpe or Rue de la Huchette). (Note that google maps pointer to the hotel is wrong wrong wrong. The hotel is not on the corner of Harpe and St Severins, but Harpe and Huchette, a much better place than you'd expect from Google maps).

Reviews.Title: “a stay in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: noflash
Reviews.Content: The room although small was neat, the facilities pristine, and the staff always pleasant, available and helpful. Breakfast at the hotel was a nice way to start the day..

Reviews.Title: “Good location, cozy rooms”
Reviews.Author: crabtreeSeoul
Reviews.Content: Location is almost everything in trip. This hotel is located in very convenient area to everywhere. 5 minute walk to Metro, Notre dame is also 5-10, City hall is also, even to Saint Germain. You can find 'almost' everything you want in walking distance from the hotel. Staffs are very friendly,I had some troubles with my credit card but they were all helpful. rooms are small but normal in Paris. Breakfast is not so good, but many good restaurants/bakeries nearby .

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and great nightly rate.”
Reviews.Author: Luve2Travel74
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the corner of a buslting street in Paris. Lots of food and very close access to the Metro. Notre Dame is viewable from the corner of the street where the metro is located. We had two rooms and were given one upgraded room. The upgraded room was larger overall and the balcony faced the busy corner that was the front of the hotel. Even though there was some noise in the street a little late at night and early in the morning, with the balcony doors shut it could barely be heard. Rooms were very clean and there was also a patisserie attached to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location !!”
Reviews.Author: Rosvienna
Reviews.Content: Very friendly English speaking staff. Room small - standard for Paris - but had everything required for a weekend stay. Clean and refurbished in a simple modern style. Perfect location next to RER B station St Michel- good for both airports - and in the middle of all the activity you would expect of the Left Bank.. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, in vibrant area!”
Reviews.Author: AmsterdamRae
Reviews.Content: The area around St.Michel/Notre Dame has a vibe unlike any other part of Paris. Everyone has a different objective or assumption of what Paris will be like and for me this area fullfills the ideals I had in my head. The hotel less so, but it is a safe, clean resting place to lay your weary head after a busy Paris-like filled day. Luckily we stayed on the first floor so only made the mistake of using the lift once to take up our luggage. However after having stayed in numerous 3 star hotels in Paris I can assure you this is the norm. Also our 'non-smoking' room was equipped with an ashtray. Otherwise this hotel is a find. I got a winter promotion so feel it was worth the price I paid. The staff in the evening wasn't overly friendly or helpful, but not generally offensive. One tip would be if travelling in a pair and not a couple, you might want to book a twin room instead of a double as sharing the double with my aging mother proved to be a bit close for comfort ;)

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets”
Reviews.Author: DPRedmond
Reviews.Content: A warm, attentive front desk staff provides the element of hospitality that makes this hotel with superb location and atmosphere deserve its top ranking.

Reviews.Title: “Our 5th stay at the D'Albe”
Reviews.Author: raphiel8
Reviews.Content: Our fith stay at the D'Albe was as always excellent.The only downside was the smell of paint in the freshly decorated rooms.The D'Albe is in an excellent spot if you like to be in the hub of things. Plenty of restaurants on the doorstep, or if you prefer somewhere more intimate it is just ashort stroll over the river where there are many fine restaurants. The R.E.R. from the airport is only a couple of hundred yards from the hotel and the staff as always are friendly and courteous, we shall be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to explore Paris”
Reviews.Author: Theme_Park_Kid
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently with my wife. It is a small hotel, but recently refurbished to high modern standards. Although the rooms are small (as are so many hotel rooms in Paris), they are kept spotless and comfortable to sleep in. Nice bathrooms too. The double glazing keeps out most of the noise, although the weekends can see some higher levels, but it does go quietier after midnight. The staff at the hotel are fantastic, always cheery and willing to help with anything. The location is fantastic, just 2 stops down the RER from Gare du Nord. You can easily walk to Notre Dame, Pompidou centre, shops and plenty of restaurants. In fact, around the hotel are numerous restaurants of all kinds to eat in, some are good, some are bad. You can eat breakfast in the hotel, which is nice, or try anywhere nearby! There is always plenty of life in the streets near the hotel! Will stay here again and recommend this hotel to everyone I know visiting Paris. For an expensive city, this is a reasonably priced hotel in a great location with lovely rooms.

Reviews.Title: “nice one”
Reviews.Author: kuka70
Reviews.Content: perfect location, 50 mt from rer and metro nice and clean, very friendly and polite staff paris-average room and breakfast if you like st.germain and modern style hotels

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: rockkchick
Reviews.Content: Lovely Hotel in a great location for seeing the sights. The room was very clean and the bed very comfortable. The bathroom was a good size and spotlesly clean. Will definately use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent base for central Paris”
Reviews.Author: Bongo60
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just as expected - excellent in every way. We arrived on the Eurostar into Gare du Nord and then just a few Metro stops to Boulevard St Michel followed by a couple of minutes walk to the hotel. When we first arrived I thought we might have been disturbed by noise at night as the area was so busy but the double glazed windows kept all noise out. (air con available for the summer) Our room on the 2nd floor was small but very recently refurbished and the bed was as comfortable as ours at home! I don't think it would be worth paying for a bigger corner room as you'll want to be out all day visiting Paris. The bathroom had a bath with a shower over it and was large in comparison to the bedroom. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel but went to the boulangerie just next door - wonderful pastries. I'd definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “So-so”
Reviews.Author: dafomin
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location, very clean facilities, friendly and helpful staff, way above average breakfast buffet, air-conditioned rooms Cons: Tiny-tiny rooms, those facing the street are unbearably noisy at night; thermostat in one of the rooms did not work Bottom line: for 150 euro per night per double-room one can do better than this

Reviews.Title: “Great for a weekend”
Reviews.Author: slyDublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for two nights for the recent France - Ireland Rugby International. On arrival we were informed that the lift was out of service, our room was on the sixth floor( Noise not an issue but maybe if you are located on the lower floors as the streets are busy below till all hours) and although this did not bother us in the slightest it may have been an issue with other guests.The hotel acknowledged this by giving us free breakfast for the two days, a nice gesture. Breakfast is not an option I would consider if I was paying as it is quite expensive for what you get, best to find a nice Cafe around the area. Other than that the rooms were clean, small but hey your not in Paris to spend it in a bedroom( Only a place to lay your head), and the staff were friendly. Location is central to a lot of attractions and with a Metro & RER stop at St Michel it is ideal for travelling to/from the airport and also to other attractions in the city. Would recommend the hotel and will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Ticked all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: bbloss
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, lovely room larger than any we have stayed in before in Paris, we seem to have scored the best room in the hotel with corner view, wrap around balcony, glimpses of Pont Neuf. Vibrancy, music from buskers below...all faded into peace & quiet when we closed the doors. Having stayed in many different locations, left and right banks, this is our pick for best location, easiest for all sight seeing, RER and metro, and great selection of easy-walk places for dinner. Will be our first choice for our next Paris stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jax-Bryan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. The hotel is nice, but not great. This was our first trip to Paris, so I was not prepared fully for the small size of the room. Our room was nice, but small, not much bigger than a cruise ship room. The walls were a little thin, so we could hear things in the next room. We did not spend alot of time in the room, so the size was not a huge issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: delanet
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on my way from USA to Africa. Had a 15 hour layover and basically utilized it to lay my bags down, show some friends around town who had never been to Paris before, get a shower and a change of clothes before continuing on. Got there in the morning with three travelling companions and we were allowed to check into our rooms early, which was great. The hotel was doing some repairs on our floor and the lift was not functioning. Not really a big deal, though. Rooms were nice and modern. About the size you would expect in downtown Paris. Bathroom was great; very clean, modern. Location of hotel was fantastic. On the left bank right off St Michel, maybe 50 yards from the Seine. We had a balcony that looked out onto St Germain. I have been to Paris several times and St Germain is my favorite area. Room price was reasonable, and staff was pleasant. I have stayed in smaller, not so nice rooms for much more in Paris. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “strongly recommended.nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sardaline
Reviews.Content: I spent very happy 5 days/4 nights with my family at the Albe Hotel. The hotel was really better than we expect -even if the renovation activities are in process during our visit-. We stayed on the 5th floor due to my suspicion of the street’s noise, but we have never complained about it.Contrary, we generally kept windows open in order to listening nice music. We did not have any breakfast in hotel, but I heard very positive comments from others. The lady at reception was very helpful during check in and checkout processes. She has arranged taxies. I am frequently travelling to major countries and cities over Europe and stayed several times 4-5 stars hotels in Paris. I would easily say that Albe was the one of the best hotel I have ever stayed in Paris. I strongly recommend Albe. ismail timor

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Choice!”
Reviews.Author: butterandjelly
Reviews.Content: I used TripAdvisor to select this hotel and it was absolutely wonderful. The rooms were clean and comfortable, the staff was helpful, and the location was amazing - Notre Dame and the Louvre were within a 10 minute walk plus an RER and a Metro station were practically outside the hotel's front door. The only bad thing about this hotel is that there's a lot of street noise - but that's to be expected in a busy area.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: NiallCDublin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an average three star which has a fantastic location right in the centre of Paris. There is a nice boulangerie outside the hotel. There are loads of restaurants in the vicinity but they are all touristy so I wouldn't recommend any of them. I would agree with the previous posts about the noise on Saturday night but the easy solution to that problem is to just party till 3 and then you'll come home to peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel. Fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: ManUtdFan7
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at Hotel D'Albe! The location (in the Latin Quarter) was great -- convenient to Notre Dame, Palace of Justice, the Seine, the Paris Metro and countless cafes and restaurants. The hotel room was on the small side (like most European hotels) but was very comfortable. We had an extra bed for our daughter but still had plenty of room. The staff was professional, helpful, and very unobtrusive. We were a bit concerned when we learned (via the hotel's website) that the lift would be out of service for most of our stay. As it turned out, the work was complete and we were able to use a brand new lift to reach our fifth floor room. Location, location, location! Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: Aggierr
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in super location, right in the middle of all the hustle and bustle. The room was clean and we had a great view. The staff were very friendly. Right beside Notre Dame which made transport very easy to access. You can get the red bus that travels around the city from here. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: TaurangaKiwi
Reviews.Content: Our initial greeting at reception was quite friendly but on checkout we had different staff who were in fact rude. The breakfast was excellent & the girl who ran the breakfast room was extemely friendly & obliging.The location was excellent - 2 minute walk to the underground & very close to Notre Dame. The rooms were very clean & on the small side but typical for Paris. I feel it was expensive for what it was & I was not impressed by the rude receptionist.

Reviews.Title: “Lift not working”
Reviews.Author: Pamperedtraveller
Reviews.Content: We had 2 kids aged 6 and 2 with us and stayed at the hotel for 2 nights in early Feb. The hotel is a 3 star but the location is rather central. Like most hotels in this city, rooms come in small sizes and of course the lift is almost non-existent or too small to fit more than 2 adults! To be objective, I will list the good and not-so good points. Pros The reception was friendly and allowed us to keep the baby stroller with them so it won't take up additional space in our room. The heating was efficient and can be adjusted. The bathroom though small had a heater next to the tub/shower. The decor looked clean and modern. The room had ample wardrobe space to keep some of our things. And it had a safe where we kept our documents. The continental breakfast was very satisfying. They had a variety of cereal, cheeses, pastries, bread, yogurt, drinks and ham to choose from. You can also get orange juice, toast, boiled eggs and fruits as well as coffee on request. If you wanted expresso or cafe creme, you can request for that too. They also served hot milk for my son's chocolate. Anyway, I couldn't fault their coffee, it was good stuff. The hotel's location is very central (in Latin Quarter) and near to several metro entrants. Except when you have a stroller... There are tons of restaurants, cafes, bakeries, shops and take-aways in the immediate vicinity, so food is not an issue for those who stay here. The semi pedestrian streets are easy to stroll around and plenty of actions during the weekends and the evenings when the place gets more vibrant. Cons We had a standard room for 3 and it was on the 4th floor - the view of room faced the unscenic view of the semi-delapidated building directly across the hotel. The lift was under renovation whilst we were there and so the noise of drilling can be heard during the day. But just imagine walking up 4 storeys, it was exhausting and something I'm not accustomed to. NOT good at all. The rooms are hardly sound proof and you can always hear your neighbours come in and out. Never mind that. But what's unbearable is that the street is noisy especially over the weekends and the windows are not sound proof enough from the rowdy activities out there. The noise level didn't die off until about 4am! Would I stay here again? I'm not sure as I suspect the rest of the hotels in paris are not that much better given my requirements for a central location without blowing my budget.

Reviews.Title: “Woke up to someone having nicked my bag from my room”
Reviews.Author: simabe
Reviews.Content: Was meeting some friends from Norway in Paris the first weekend of February. However, they got stuck at the airport due to bad weather, so I had to spend the first night at the hotel alone. As I was alone, I made sure to lock the door and hang the "do not disturb"-sign on the door before going to bed, as I wanted a good nights sleep. The next morning however, I couldn't find one of my handbags. And the door was slightly open. Ran downstairs to the reception, but they hardly listened to me, refusing to believe that someone could have entered the room while I was sleeping. And first then was I made aware of there being a safe in the room and given a key to it - a bit late isn't it, when your passport, ticket back to London, Ipod and camera is missing?! So we had to spend half a day at the police office reporting the whole thing - our trip obviously didn't start off so well. However, it doesn't stop here. The next morning, me and my friends was going downstairs when one of the girls, half laughing, said "that isn't your bag though, is it?" pointing at one of the maids carrying a hand bag. Well, it bloody was!!! So I told her I wanted my bag (!), she carried it downstairs to the reception - and apparently it was found where the cleaners keep bed linen and towels. Thank god, my passport and train ticket was still in the bag, but my Ipod and camera wasn't of course. The next day I spoke to the hotel manager when checking out. He did apologize for what had happened (although refused to believe that someone employed at the hotel could have done it - who else could have opened a locked door though - and known I was alone in the room?), and told me that I would get my losses refunded through the hotel's insurance. I sent them the receipts as soon as I got home, but I still haven't heard from them, even after sending follow up e-mails. By all means, the hotel was cute - but it doesn't help much when you get robbed in your room while sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Y_Tz_99
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel. Excellent location, rather small but clean rooms. Good value for price

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - no complaints at all”
Reviews.Author: laly111
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a long weekend in mid-January for our wedding anniversary. The location is absolutely perfect, on a pedestrian street round the corner from Notre Dame, opposite metro stop St Michel (direct line from Gare du Nord). I chose a special offer on an upgraded room, which was very nice: decent size, nice bathroom, everything perfectly clean. The only downside was the bed was two singles put together, not a double as we had hoped. We gained more space by upgrading, but this meant twin beds sadly. The area is busy at night, which is good if you are nervous about secluded spots in unfamiliar cities. We did not suffer from noise as the previous reviewer did, although there were some street performers during the day and evening. Most activities ceased by midnight, but the occasional shout from passing people could disturb the lighter sleepers, I'm sure. The staff were friendly and helpful, and we couldn't fault the hotel's standards.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but even earplugs weren’t enough….”
Reviews.Author: SurfsUp60
Reviews.Content: Our family of three stayed at the D’Albe in the days leading up to New Years (Friday 12/28, Saturday 12/29, and Sunday 12/30). We liked the hotel a lot. The room was clean and comfortable – a bargain for Paris. The bathroom was very large, and looked new, even to having a heated floor. The staff, all the way to housekeeping, was very friendly. Even the stuff in the mini-bar was reasonably priced, and the bakery downstairs was a convenient and tasty way to start the day. Unfortunately, there’s a big “but” on the way. Location. It is a great location as a base for exploring Paris. But it’s not a great location if you want some sleep. It is a VERY buy area. We read Trip Advisor before we went, and even packed several different sets of earplugs. But what we experienced went beyond the realm of “street noise” – that is, the buzz of voices on a crowded street, punctuated by the occasional laughs and shouts of more exuberant pedestrians (the hotel is located on a pedestrian only street). What happened, at least while we were there, was Street Performance, lasting to the wee hours of the morning. And not just by magicians, mimes, or even musicians armed with just their voice and an acoustic guitar. These people had portable PA systems – and car batteries to power them! In front of the bookstore on the corner of Blvd St. Michel and Rue de la Huchette, an Afro/pop/cover band was in residence. They had acoustic guitars and percussion, which were all amplified (and they were quite good). They pointed out toward the busy Blvd St. Michel, and weren’t really the direct cause of noise for the hotel. But right around the corner from them, on Rue de la Huchette, there was another performance spot – just steps from the hotel entrance. On Friday night, it was some type of street drum group, complete with call and response, and crowd participation. Our earplugs were worthless, because you see, this second group had to be at least as loud, if not louder, than the first group around the corner in order to be heard! Somewhere in the middle of the night my son was in tears because he couldn’t sleep. It was about 4 AM when we finally crashed out. Since we were just coming off an overnight trans-Atlantic flight, we awoke positively shattered. Needless to say we lost the activities we had planned for the next morning. We were lucky to make it out the room before housekeeping arrived. When we returned to the hotel on Saturday night – at about 10 pm – the cover band was already drawing a crowd on the Blvd St. Michel, but this time a group of break dancers were setting up on the Rue de la Huchette – complete with a battery powered PA system. So we got rap music and crowd cheering well into Sunday morning. Earplugs again were no help. There was little sleep until things got quiet. We were almost afraid to return to the hotel on Sunday night, but we did, to the find the pop band and break dancers again set up. Fortunately, the streets were a little quieter and the crowds weren’t that thick for the dancers (maybe because they had been performing throughout day on Sunday). It did get quieter earlier – say 12:30 am – and we got more sleep than on the previous nights. But sitting on the Eurostar on Monday morning, we were absolutely fried. We got to our hotel in London – and took a nap. A couple of things here…we are not light sleepers. And we are fairly well traveled, having experienced the crowds of the World Cup in Germany in 2006. The other thing was, our room was as far down the Rue de la Huchette as you could get from the performance area. The other side of the hotel faced it directly. I can’t imagine what those guests experienced. So I’ve come to the conclusion that the rooms are so reasonably priced because of the location. There probably are quieter times to stay at the D’Albe, but it’s a crapshoot to figure out when. A previous Trip Advisor poster likened the area to Bourbon Street. It’s also a lot like summertime on the boardwalk at Ocean City, Maryland. Before making our reservation, we had been looking at more expensive hotels in less busy areas of Paris. As I stared sleeplessly at the ceiling in the A.M. of Sunday morning, that cost difference looked like a bargain. At that moment I would’ve gladly paid double the difference for a quiet room and closed eyes. We won’t stay at the D’Albe again, but I wouldn’t tell people unequivocally not to. Just be aware of the possibilities. If you're someone who might enjoy being out late on the streets of Paris, then this might be a perfect hotel for you. It just didn't work for a family who was trying to get to sleep before midnight. I feel bad writing this review because the hotel really did nothing wrong. If the hotel were located somewhere just a little quieter, I would go back in a heartbeat. But we saw Paris through a groggy haze because of our lack of sleep. It’s one of the few times Trip Advisor let us down.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: wilfjn
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel D'Albe for a nice long weekend 11-14th January 2008. Coming from London on Eurostar it is ideally located on Line 4 of the underground from Paris Norde. Come out the correct gate and it a very short walk to see the Hotel clearly labelled and visible. Rooms are very neat and clean, bathroom very clean. Rooms serviced daily at a high standard. Staff are very courteous and helpful. My first time in Europe I was amazed at the ease with which the recepionist switched from French to English as she greeted me and saw I spoke English. Booked over the Internet with the special proce bookin was swift and clean. Only one night payment required up front, the rest paid upn departure. The Seine was visbile from our third room wndow. Countless restaurants where nearby ranging through all palates and price ranges. The breakfast in D'Albe was a great and substantial start to the day. A few short steps saw one on the bank of the Seine with the islands and Notre Dame a short stroll. On departing they stored luggage for a later pickup. I have always liked to get a fine location near the centre. This certainly fitted it for me at a quite reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: AnonLancs_UK
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect, right in the heart of the Latin Quarter. The standard of the rooms was excellent, very clean and fresh with no fuss. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful and the breakfast was great, offering a great variety of choices. I would definately stay there again and recomend the Hotel D'Albe to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Just about perfect for a burst visit to Paris”
Reviews.Author: airportrpg
Reviews.Content: I have had the te pleasure of visiting Paris many times, and have stayed in all manner of hotels and apartment rentals. I have recommended D'Albe St. Michel to my friends for years for its perfect location (Place St. Michel, literally a stone's throw from Notre Dame, and almost atop the St. Michel Metro entrance which serves the same Metro line as Gare du Nord and the RER line for the Eiffel Tower) and its pristine servicable service standards. This is the hotel for any visit that puts a premium on being out and about. D'Albe St. Michel is a fantastic value...almost too good to be true given its location and standards. Sure, teeny tiny rooms (but not abnormally so), and no services (offers a continental breakfast in the lobby, if you somehow find the bakery just outside the hotel's entrance to be too good to experience), and sure it practically anchors the restaurant alley, but there is absolutely no risk in the D'Albe St. Michel. If you want better restaurants, the Metro will wisk you whereever your heart desires, and practically all 4/5/6 Arrondissement restaurants are within a 15-minute walk at most, and most far closer. Sure, you can pay more and get more, but if your time in Paris is to be spent outside of the hotel, you can't do better than D'Albe St. Michel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Hotel D'Albe”
Reviews.Author: RobMc54
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in a triple room overlooking the wonderful, energy filled streets around St Michel and with a glimse of the river. The hotel is clean, staff excellent, good breakfast and the rooms are of reasonable size. The location is excellent being close to St Michel Metro, hundreds of restaurants and a stroll to everywhere. I can recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: member1000
Reviews.Content: Great location. Right beside a metro stop but you can walk to all the central sights. Surrounded by restaurants. As others mention you may wish to take ear plugs if you are easily woken by noise. Contrary to others we were not impressed by downstairs bakery- ok for convenience but produce nowhere as nice as you could get elsewhere- try the markets 5min east along Bld St Germain. Overall would recommend and would return next time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “location, location”
Reviews.Author: bettyUK
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel in a superb location - 150 yards or so from the river and with a lively street below. The hotel is clean and attractive. Rooms are small, but attractive and with all the essentials (take your own kettle though if you like to make a brew). The location is fantastic - the down side is that you're likely to experience noise late evening - so you may want to take ear plugs if this might be an issue for you. Staff are very helpful, they went the extra mile to help us sort out a restautrant for New Year's Eve, and it was no trouble to leave bags on our last day when we were catching a late train. Do watch out for pickpockets in Paris though, one of our party had her Ipod stolen en route to the hotel - not a great introduction to paris! Breakfast in the hotel, or pick up your choice from the excellent boulangerie below.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Fabulous! (heated towels, great location - what could be better?)”
Reviews.Author: GThreepwood
Reviews.Content: While in Paris, I stayed in two different hotels (Hotel Muguet and this one), this being the latter and the better (from 12/12 - 12/14/07). We booked a triple room which came with: 1 double bed, 1 single bed, a flat screen TV (2 English-speaking channels), safe box, and a large-sized-for-Europe bathroom (equipped with standing shower, hair blow dryer and heated towels!!) The only downside to the room is that wireless internet connection is not free. (They sell access cards at the front desk and there is also an internet cafe around the corner from the hotel.) The front-desk folks are extremely nice and helpful! The surrounding area can only be described as perfect! The area is very lively in the evenings and very safe during the day; we did a few morning runs along the River Seine, which is just a stones throw away. Right downstairs from you is a bakery for your morning croissant and coffee. On every street flanking the hotel, around every corner, and across the way are plenty of souvenir and Parisian shops (Etam, Cote a Cote). There are also numerous restaurant choices all around, a French book shop right across the hotel door entrance, and for those aching for a "regular" sized coffee by American standards, there is even a Starbucks just 2-3 minute walk away (although I preferred the downstairs bakery)! Here is the approximate time/distance it took us to get to various places from this hotel: Notre Dame Cathedral - 5-10 minute walk (cross the bridge and you're practically there) Monmarte (for the Moulin Rouge) - 15-20 minute cab ride Gare du Noir - 20 minute cab ride Metro stop - 1 minute walk (Saint-Michel stop) I would absolutely stay at this hotel again and definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel and Paris!!!”
Reviews.Author: MelissaL81
Reviews.Content: We LOVED this hotel!! I did a lot of research for a mother daughter trip that my mom and I took to Paris. It was very important to us to stay at hotel that had a good location, clean "American" bathrooms, and a great ambiance. This hotel is everything we were looking for. We waned to stay where the action was and this area of Paris is full of restaurants, sights, and shops. The hotel is a block of off the river and a few blocks from Notre Dame. It is also a block from the Metro. The hotel is small and very cute and has a great Paris feel. There is a bakery downstairs that is to die for and has the best French pastries. It is a great place for breakfast. We did all of the normal "Paris" things, but our favorite was just to wander around and look at all of the amazing architecture. You will not be disappointed at this hotel. .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sloach
Reviews.Content: Great location right in the center of Paris. Very clean room, staff were friendly. Great value. I would recommend this to anyone staying in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great position, typically parisian staff”
Reviews.Author: buggs888
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fantastic position & very close to many of the major sights. Rooms are clean and tidy but quite small - this was expected in Paris. The hotel staff were 'somewhat' helpful but could have been more friendly. I was ill & my husband attempted to order a cup of tea via room service (which they provided a menu) only to be told that they don't actually have room service. He finally got a cup of tea (although they dont have a kettle & heated the water in a microwave) & charged us $5 AUS dollars for the cup of water. Overall we enjoyed our stay at the hotel, and if you are looking for a simple & clean hotel in Paris we would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Kimdeb
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location, exactly as described by previous reviews in tripadvisor. Spotless, up to date, wonderful breakfast- I think it is a much better deal than the bakery next door because of the neverending cafe au lait, croissants, pain au chocolat, lovely room and lovely waitress. Our only complaint was the noise late at night ( Friday and Saturday) and since the air conditioning was off . If you wanted some air in the room you had to open the window- when the window was shut , the noise was no problem- Took the RER train right from the airport and walked the 50 yards or less to the hotel- Great for a long weekend Walked to all the museums, le Marais district, etc...

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Hotel, the best location !”
Reviews.Author: rodpmo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located. The decoration is modern and the room is very clean. Furniture is new, LCD TV, and the bathroom has all the facilities. Great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GGGP
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a great location. I wouldnt even look for another hotel if I visit Paris again as this one is just perfect for the price. I cannot recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Wondeful stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: jjjlda
Reviews.Content: The Albe was a wonderful place to stay if you are on a budget and want to visit Paris. The location is great, definitely within walking distance to many of the major sites and very close to the Metro and RER. The room was clean, comfortable, and a decent size compared to other Parisian hotels I have stayed in. The staff was very friendly and helpful in offering recommendations. If there was anything I can say that was not perfect, it would be the noise on the weekend evenings. It wasn't too bad, but the location gets very busy in the evening, especially weekends, and had our room not been on the top floor it might have been a little more annoying. Overall, this is a great choice and offers a lot for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: g0g
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights at the end of October, and would have nothing but positive things to say about the place. Location: Right beside a few metro/RER lines, one of which connects directly to CDG. Right beside the Seine (Notre Dame very close by) and it's walkable to anywhere as far across as the Eiffel Tower. Great (and heaps of them!) restaurants nearby and a lively area at night. Hotel: Small-ish but modern and perfectly clean - everything you could need is there. We had a fourth floor room looking onto the street (as all of their rooms do). Breakfast was available in the hotel (and looked very nice), but we chose to wander to the nearby cafes most mornings. Staff: The staff were very helpful throughout our stay, recommending things to do and times/days to go there. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone heading to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: MARKPerthAustralia
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Paris where we spent 4 wonderful nights at the hotel D'albe.We first stayed at this hotel in July last year after finding out about it through trip advisor. Last year we had 2 rooms as we were travelling with our 2 teenager daughters. We loved everything about the hotel It is very central , right near the underground and many restuarants and Paris sights.Despite being in a very noisy area the double glazed windows kept the noise down. The rooms are small but spotlessly clean and very comfortable.The breakfasts were outstanding and run by the most delightful and helpful waitress In fact all the staff were most helpful This year we returned to the hotel in October after our wonderful summer holiday As last time the rooms were clean, breakfast great , staff pleasant BUT no air con . it was explained that as it was not summer it had been turned off. The only problem was that due to the incredible noise outside we could not open the window so the room was unpleasntly stuffy I will return to this hotel but will make sure it is in the summer months when the air con is turned on.

Reviews.Title: “very cute hotel in latin quarter”
Reviews.Author: crystalSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: A very cute no-frills hotel in the heart of the Latin Quarter. Small but tidy rooms. Right above a delicious bakery. Lots of action right out the door--cafes, bakeries, restaurants, and lots of people. I would absolutely recommend this hotel based solely on location. How much time do you spend in the hotel room in Paris anyway?

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. great location!”
Reviews.Author: True_visit
Reviews.Content: I visit Paris often and this time decided to stay in Latin Quarter. Hotel - very friendly English speaking staff Room: size is tiny for a 3*, i stayed in a double alone and it was not that bad but for 2 people won't recommend Windows - double glazed open and close properly (not usual for Paris), although was noisy at night as they had street entertainment but not that bad. Aircon - is on top of the door - very wise as usually they tend to be on top of your head. Bathroom - clean, i had shower, working fine and very powerful TV - good size on the dressing table (and not a tiny one far in the ceiling) There was even a safe and minibar. You can by water and store it there as well as there was some room. Breakfast - cost 10Euros, i didn't take it as i don't like to get up to certain time. Just next door to the hotel is an amazing bakery with some tables outside. Location - convinient for everything, 5 min to any place in the left bank and just across the river is Notre Dame and Hotel De Ville. 10-15 min walk to Louvre and Opera. Night life - all around the hotel you can find never ending restaurants, bars, cafes, cinemas...anything you want, lots of greek restaurants and everything else. Can recommend La Lutece, it is across the road from St.Michel station, steak was excellent as well as very french atmosphere. Tip - now you can rent bicycles everywhere. They have special parking spots all around Paris and you can pick it up at one stop and drop-off on another. No hassle. They are all the same beige colour.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: aitchjayes
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for 3 nights and were impressed with the layout and the location. It is so hard to research hotels in a city such as Paris as there are so many to choose from and it takes time to trawl through all reviews. I am glad I picked this hotel. We took a taxi from Gard du Nord (arrived on the Eurostar from Ashford), and then took the Metro back to the station as it was on 1.50 euro each as against 12 euros in the taxi. As written previously the hotel is a stones throw from Notre Dame and about 20mins walk from The Louvre. The metro was easy to use especially if you are used to the London Underground. Would recommend this hotel to anyone. We had a twin no-smoking room on the 4th floor. Breakfast was adequate although not a lot of choice. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Paris, Paris, Paris....”
Reviews.Author: conair
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend in Paris, and we stayed at the Albe Hotel. The location is perfect (or may be impossible better!!) just two steps from the 2 main subways lines (and one goes direct to PCD airport!!), in the middle of the Saint Michel district, and one minute walking from the Notre Dame Cathedral. The room was very clean and big enough to fit 2 adults and two children (triple room in the corner), the staff were really nice and helpful. The breakfast was included, however just average. If your room does not include breakfast, go just round the corner, and you will find lots of patiseries. In summary a great Hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Vinetterroirs
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel smack in the middle of the latin quarter in Paris. The room was clean, the staff were really sweet and helpful and they were quite happy to speak english when we proved that our french vocabulary only consisted of "bonjour" and "merci"... We we're impressed at how quiet the room was, even though its windows faced a busy street. The room was air conditioned, it had a handy safe, the bathroom was small, but clean. We didn't have breakfast included in our package, but had breakfast the morning we were leaving, and even that impressed us. The location is absolutely wonderful (if you do like staying in an area that never sleeps!). There are plenty of restaurants close to the hotel. The street just outside the hotel is a real tourist trap, so we decided to walk a bit further away to find more authentic Paris restaurants. Bld St Germain is really close, as is Bld St Michel, and in the less busy side streets you can find great places to eat. The Notre Dame is just a few minutes away, and the metro stops St Michel and Cluny are just round the corner. The RER train (regional train) connects St Michel to both Charles de Gaulle and Orly Airport, which is really handy. If you think location is important and also value a decent standard hotel, I'd choose this one. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: Calgary1964
Reviews.Content: The Hotel D'Albe St Michel was great value for money and a fabulous vacation. We visited the hotel from October 11-21, 2007 and our initial reaction was that the rooms were not unlike a cruise ship...very small, cramped, with tiny hallways leading to the rooms. However we discovered that the rooms were immaculate, and had everything that we needed. We had friends staying at the Ritz during the metro strike & our location was so much easier to walk get to things without transportation that we felt that we lucked out. Coming from North America we are getting used to smoke free enviromnets so if you are challenged with smoke this is not the place for you. We were on a no smoking floor, however I think most Europeans don't care & smoke in whatever room they want so that was likely the only discomfort we experienced as it definately wafted into our room. The front desk staff was so helpful and gave us great suggestions for dinner, shopping etc. The housekeeping staff had to be reminded to leave soap or towels every day but kept the room clean. We would defiantely return to this hotel and would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Je'taime paris et l'hotel albe”
Reviews.Author: kipkidjenn
Reviews.Content: what a lovely hotel. All staff were so obliging and accomodating. the location of this hotel is excellent. Just a few mins from the famous 'Notre Dame' church and the 'Lovre'. The hotel is It's the heart of the latin quarter of Paris - cobbled streets with lots and lots of character and atmosphere. next to st michele RER and Metro stations making access to the rest of the city effortless. My fiance and I had a wonderful 4 day stay in Paris, that was made even lovlier bay the satff at the holel albe. We cant wait to go back again. we would both highly recommend this hotel to frinds and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great find, as central as you can get”
Reviews.Author: cgabanyi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great little find, right in the centre of Paris. Modern, comfortable and clean, very good value for Paris. Didn't have breakfast at the hotel as there are so many cafes nearby. Lift is a bit small but no other complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: AusCH
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small but very clean and recently renovated. The price is very reasonable for the location, and the state of the rooms. Location is superb, only a minute walk from the metro, and you can walk to a lot of the sights. Breakfast is excellent. The staff are incredibly helpful; gave great restaurant recommendations. Only negative would be that i can be a little noisy - however we were staying on the weekend of the Rugby world cup final and as our room was on the street side, there were lots of people around so it may not be like that all the time. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel for a stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “NIce Place”
Reviews.Author: StevefromMissouri
Reviews.Content: Basically read all the previous reviews from past travellers to Paris and the Hotel D'Albe St Michel was very well thought of. We booked a triple corner room with a small balcony. Room was clean, tidy and well-attended. Bathroom was impeccable. Room was small for three adults, but everything in Paris is. Not a drawback, because how much time do you spend in your room anyway? Well located in Paris, across the Seine from Notre Dame. The only thing which may make some people shy away from this hotel was the street noise. It is on the edge of the Latin Quarter which is often depicted as slow and easy-going and sometimes quieter. The hotel is located at a convergence of three streets with tons of restaurants and cafes. A huge gathering place for tourists and Parisians in general. It gets noisy at night with the street performers, revellers and general street noise. It didn't bother us, but I could see where it might for a light sleeper. The staff at the hotel was awesome in helping us. All in all a good place to stay! -Steve in Missouri, USA

Reviews.Title: “Great for first time visitors”
Reviews.Author: bscrim
Reviews.Content: I highly recomment this hotel for first time visitors to Paris: - easy to get to from CDG airport ( just one block to metro ) - close to many sites. I went with my mother and it was nice that the hotel was close enough that we could easily stop at the hotel for a rest if needed - stroll to the Seine / Notre Dame in minutes - front desk very friendly and helpful - clean, safe and quiet with the windows closed The restaurants in the immediate area are > not very good. It seems like busloads of tourists are unloaded here by the hundreds to eat on their own. Definately LEAVE the immediate area meals !

Reviews.Title: “fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: butterfieldCocork
Reviews.Content: loved the hotel,staff very pleasant.hotel could not have been more central to everything,only problem was that breakfast was very expensive considering that there was a boulangerie directly downstairs which did fine breakfasts at a much lower price.will stay again as i found it very clean and warm decor

Reviews.Title: “Fullers Rugby World cup campaign.”
Reviews.Author: JFRManchester
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Paris for the start of our World Cup campaign wondering what our hotel would be like as we had commited to staying there for four seperate weekends. Situated adjacent to the RER B from Charles De Gaulle in a buzzing area of restaraunts and bars.
