We were greeted by Cecile and Alexandre who were extremely welcoming and helped to make our stay as trouble free as possible. We had our breakfast included in the price but it would be worth paying extra to meet the lovely waitress who serves breakfasts who constantly smiles and can not do enough for you. As we were lucky enough to get to the final, we decided to try and bring out our three daughters, Cecile managed to squeeze and extra bed in a larger room for us when I know the hotel was fully booked and helped our two other daughters find there accomodation, all this inspite of the fact that we had beaten France to get to the final!!! She was a star. I can only glowingly recommend this hotel the staff are great and it is situated within easy reach of all that you would need to make your stay stress free. We will definately return at the earliest opportunity. Do try it you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Squibob
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed here last month for a weekend. the room was clean and tiny but otherwise very unremarkable. the elevator can only fit 2 people comfortably (no, we're not obese) and the cables creak loudly as it slowly moves up the floors. wonder how much longer they will last. It's in a good location, yes, but also at the edge of the loudest area of Latin Quarters. Kind of like Bourbon Street. the concierge gave us two recommendation for nearby restaurants but they were both quite expensive even though we asked for moderately priced places, and not all that good. overall decent but I wouldn't go back. next door is an excellent little patisserie.

Reviews.Title: “great location, very helpfull & freindly staff”
Reviews.Author: VoyageurVancouver
Reviews.Content: What a treat to have Internet right in the hotel. Very helpfull & friendly staff. Size of the room is what you expect for an older building, but clean and not too bad for sound. Very good location. Easy walking distance to the markets and lots of restaurants. Loved the elevator! Also lots of shopping to be done. The Military bands were in town and we caught a number of their performances. Really added to the experience. It is worth walking around the large square at night just to listen to the different street musicians. Would come back and stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “No room at the Inn”
Reviews.Author: chrisc00
Reviews.Content: We booked months in advance, paid our deposit and received our conformation but still arrived and had no room. They claimed there was a "technical" problem and sent us off down the street with our many bags and no help - only directions to another hotel. They said they would have our room the next day, which they did but we should have never returned. The room was average and they made no accommodation for the problems they caused. Find a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel D'Albe”
Reviews.Author: RetiredTravelers7
Reviews.Content: What a pleasure doing business with this hotel! Communication via e-mail and in person at the Hotel D'Albe was caring, thorough and efficient from booking to check-out. We even received a thank you note upon our return home! The Hotel D'Albe offers a very peaceful, well run, immaculate establishment. The price was reasonable for a very convenient location within walking distance to most attractions. The neighborhood in the Latin Quarter was lively, fun and safe and only steps to the Metro. You can expect the rooms to be on the small side by American Standards but they are updated, very, very clean, nicely decorated and comfortable. We only wished we could have stayed longer. Employees at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. We appreciated that they were nice enough to hold our luggage before and after check out times and that they helped us find the proper transportation to move four people with luggage to an outlying area of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect :)”
Reviews.Author: Lovinmylou
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel D'Albe during my last visit to Paris. Let me tell you, I LOVE this hotel. Like many others have said, it is on the smaller side, but for as often as you are in your hotel - who cares?!?!? The employees at the hotel were wonderful and extremely helpful. The hotel is located right in the middle of everything. Great shopping, restaurants, people... what more could you ask for? The room we stayed in even had a view of the bell towers of Notre Dame. It was amazing! I am planning my next trip to Paris and will absolutely be staying at the Hotel D'Albe again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small room”
Reviews.Author: JeanniesDiary
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Albe for only two days recently after reading the reviews on this website. I must say that I was disappointed with the room as it was at the back of the hotel and was TINY by European standards, which was contrary to the general impressions I got from the reviews. The room was however clean and the bathroom quite large which was great, the location wonderful if you're into restaurants and cool bars as we are. Great for a few days but I wouldn't recommend if staying in Paris for longer than that.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: France_Please
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were extremely helpful and went out of their way to assist us. Our room with double bed had plenty of space for 2 suitcases and room for us to unpack. We could also easily walk around the bed, even though there was a writing desk as well. Everything was clean and comfortable, decor very nice and the room service each day was excellent. We had balcony windows - even with them open it was quiet inside.The bathroom was large enough for the two of us, but the only fault we found was that the shower over the bath only had a half screen so it was almost necessary to shower sitting down to avoid wetting all the bathroom. Location of the hotel was perfect - close to all restaurants, the Seine & Notre Dame, and the metro. We loved our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Choice”
Reviews.Author: TandCDevon_England
Reviews.Content: Having been asked by our American friends to organise hotel accommadation in Paris, I was concerned to choose well. After reading several reviews on the internet, I selected the Hotel D'Albe and can honestly say that I could not have made a better choice. The hotel location in the Latin Quarter was 'at the heart' of French life and was so convenient for visiting the Notre Damme, Louvre, Pompidou Centre, Pantheon etc. The hotel staff were very helpful and most friendly - the bedrooms were bright, clean, and well furnished - breakfasts were more than adequate. All in all, the Hotel D'Albe surpassed all our expectations, and we would heartily recommend it to anyone and intend to stay there again on our next visit. Terry & Chris (Devon, England)

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: BchVball
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Albe. This hotel has an exceptional staff, and a great location. I will definitely recommend this hotel to others. Thank you for helping to make our stay in Paris grand.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle of the action-and so close to metros!!”
Reviews.Author: malinmaid
Reviews.Content: This was exactly what I expected. The rooms are not large but spotlessly clean. The showerroom was small but perfect-- Large shower and so fresh and clean. You just walk out the door of the hotel and all life is there-bookshops -boulangerie-restaurants-take away and sit in- felt very safe despite being so lively. Was surprised how quiet the rooms were at night-thought with the street outside being so busy it might be a problem . Would stay again. Just a stroll to Notre Dame-slightly longer to Musee d'Orsay -short stroll to Saint Chapelle( do not miss this--it is breathtaking)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: riancloete
Reviews.Content: Small hotel with excellent staff in the right position

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: d460
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. Lots to do and see with in minutes walk. The smell of the bakery on the corner in the morning was an added charm. The streets below the hotel are busy with people in the evening but the rooms are sound proofed enough that it wasn't a problem. Great friendly staff and very convenient wi-fi access too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LC123Scotland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel D'Albe St Michel for two nights in September. The room, although small, was perfectly adaquate for two people. The bathroom was clean, and fresh towels were supplied on our second day. The service at reception was welcoming and they even allowed us to leave our baggage with them on the day of our departure, so that we could take in a few last sights. The location could not be better. Just across the road from the tube station and a 2 minute walk from Notre Dame. We will definitely be back and would reccommed this hotel to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rafa00
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel! very clean, perfectly located. We were in a superior room, where the view was to the senna river. The hotel is very closed of metropolitan and RER, and only five minutes (or less) to Notre Dame Cathedral. We are sure that we will repeat this hotel the next time that we come back to Paris. Thanks for all.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: garun
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for me and my sisters at the Albe because the hotel we usually stay at was fully booked. As it turned out, we will be staying at the Albe for future visits. The Junior suite was spacious and the bathroom very nice. The location, around the corner from St.Michel, was perfect. We usually had breakfast at the bakery which is located on the ground floor of the hotel building, very convenient. But on the last day we decided to have breakfast at the hotel, which I can reccommend. The service at the hotel was very friendly and everything succeded our expectations. I would highly reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: fhafner1
Reviews.Content: I always love staying at the Hotel D'Albe. The Location right in the middle of the Latin Quarter is perfect for exploring Paris. You are within walking distance of Notre Dame, the Louvre, and right on the river Seine in the middle of the city. The hotel has great service and the rooms are very nice and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Left Bank Charm”
Reviews.Author: NVFROG
Reviews.Content: The D'Albe hotel was a super way to end our two week vacation to Normandy, for the two nights of September 13th and 14th, 2007 .I picked it because of the great reviews on Trip Advisor and easy to find from the airport where our tour ended. We took the RER from and to the airport and 30 minutes we were in a nice hotel room watching the busy Latin quarter bustle from our window. We had a large room on the first floor with 3 large windows for viewing the streets at night. My husband, who is quite picky, said that our two nights at the D'Albe were one of the highlights of the trip. With the windows closed it was very peaceful and very quiet. A very special thanks to Cecile and the rest of the friendly staff at the D'Albe for making our ending to our France trip enjoyable. Tripadvisor member from the state of Nevada

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: als281138
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Hotel d'Albe several times previously and found it well up to standard. The room was comfortable, the staff pleasant and helpful and the breakfast excellent. My only complaint (a very minor one) was that it was very difficult to take a shower without flooding the bathroom floor as there was no shower curtain or screen at the shower end of the bath. The designer had, for reasons best known to him or her, put the screen at the other end! I should certainly return to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel D-Albe: Best Personnel, Service, Accommodations for Paris Visit”
Reviews.Author: ParisFirstTimer
Reviews.Content: E-mail correspondence with Alexandre was superb in setting up 6-night accommodations & assuring that expectations were met. Room was very clean, modern, comfortable with adequate space in city renown for lesser accommodations. Entire staff was very helpful & accurate with every query or assistance requested. Perfect location next to St Michel for using Metro to get everywhere: direct route to Versailles, Eiffel Tower, etc. Rate reasonable. Would rebook......absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a good position”
Reviews.Author: trinita6
Reviews.Content: Hotel clean and staff helpful. Perfect position close to Notre Dame, Saint Germain and metro stop. Perfect for a walk or to jog along the Seine. Of course a bit noisy in the evening but not that much. Price is high for low budget travellers but for a couple I think is a good solution.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: RAmlani
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is awesome. There is a bakery right next door to the hotel. Great croissants and crepes. Also, there are ample of restaurants to choose from within the vicinity of the hotel. As the hotel faced a busy street, it was noisy at night and difficult to sleep but we managed to sleep through all that noise. The rooms as per Canadian standards was small but we did find it was not cramped and was still spacious. The bathrooms were very clean except the bathtubs did not have shower curtains. That was a challenge to try and take a shower without getting the bathroom floors flooded. The only complaint I would have is the front desk person (daytime) was very unfriendly and not very helpful. We had asked him for some directions and he was very rude and not helpful at all. However, the lady running the breakfast room was very cheerful and very friendly. I would highly recommend this hotel as the location is in the Latin Quarter. R.Amlani, Edmonton, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: ciaranroddy
Reviews.Content: To celebrate 25 years of marriage, my wife and I spent 4 days at the Hotel D'Albe. We selected this hotel after reading reviews on Trip Adviser. We were not dissappointed. The hotel is in a fantastic location right in the middle of the Latin Quater. The hotel is very clean and modern and the staff very courteous and helpful. The only downfall as mentioned in other reviews is the price of the breakfast (13 euro each). We and from what I observed, many others, chose to have breakfast next door at 4 euro each. We enjoyed our stay so much that we plan to bring our children next year. Before we left we asked to see the family rooms which were superb. We will be back next year. Thank you D'Able for a memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HondaVFR
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel D'Albe for a long weekend to celebrate our Silver Wedding Anniversary. The staff were all very friendly and helpful at all times. We arrived fairly early on the Friday morning (around 10.30am) and the receptionist rang to check that our room was ready. Our double room was so we dumped our suitcases and headed for the Notre Dame which is a 5 minute walk away from the hotel. Our children (16 and 14) had a separate twin room two floors down. The receptionist checked that this would be a satisfactory arrangement before checking us in. The hotel was clean and double glazing kept the street sounds out of the room enabling a quiet night's sleep. There was plenty of wardrobe and luggage space in the room. The reception area was bright and airy and welcoming. The rooms looked as though they were cleaned thoroughly every day. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in central Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Sopranos
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in a brilliant location and is a two minute walk to the Metro. The room that we received was excellent and overlooked the hustle and bustle of the Latin Quarter. The staff were extremely helpful and pleasant. I would definitely stay here on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Location!”
Reviews.Author: lbltd
Reviews.Content: This was a terrific Hotel! The location could not have been better-right in the heart of St Michel and close to the Metro. I was worried that it might be noisey, but even when a lot was going on in the street, once the windows were closed you did not hear a thing! Our package included breakfast which was excellant and we were always taken care of by a WONDERFUL woman that was cheerful and so pleasant every morning. The room was perfect; clean, comfortable, good shower. I would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location but certainly not the best”
Reviews.Author: RazzTazz23
Reviews.Content: I've been to Paris about 15 times and generally stay in the 5th. The area is lively, though extremely touristy. If you are a first time visitor to Paris, the 5th is recommended. That being said, i've stayed at some really good hotels and some really bad ones in the 5th. I'll put the Albe in the 7/10 range, not the best, certainly not the worst. As for my stay at d'Albe, I decided to give it a try because of an amazing deal I got on the web. I paid a discounted rate for 3 nights and got a 4th night free and a free breakfast every morning. If I was paying full rate (or nearly full rate) I would have been disappointed with my room. Location: Smack dab in the middle of the Latin Quarter. This is good and bad. This is good because you can walk or metro or cab to nearly anywhere quickly. This is bad because d'Albe is located on a pedestrian street. Some cab drivers will drop you off at the front of the hotel. Some will not. Thus, you may have to drag your luggage through crowds to get to the hotel. The lobby: The lobby is very modern and fresh looking. The staff: The staff is friendly enough. They made a reservation for us. Though I had a few problems here and there where the staff would take a smoke break and lock the front hotel door. Thus I had to lounge around out front of the hotel and wait for them to get back to open the door again. This generally happened only later at night (11pm-1am) The room: Small like most of Paris hotels that are not outrageously expensive. It had a safe and a flat panel TV. It had a tiny desk. It had a tiny closet. The room also had a small bathroom. We did not have a tub. We only had a shower stall (i'm American so shower stall is aok). The room looked like it was sort of remodeled recently. Maybe fresher carpet but definitely showing age. The lights flickered a lot. It only had one outlet to charge my phone/camera/computer. The bathroom showed a bit of age. The shower was not as clean as I hoped, a bit of mold here and there. The toilet ran unless you gave it a whack. I also could rarely get consistent hot water in the morning, though hot water flowed freely after 3pm. (I checked with others staying and they had similar problems). The air conditioning worked wonderfully. I could make the room freezing. Breakfast: They get danishes and croissants from the bakery next door so it was all fresh. They had coffee, cheese, some hard boiled eggs and ham. For free it was very nice. For pay, you can walk next door and get a fresh hot danish for a euro or two. Overall, I didn't love it. It was very mediocre. For around the same price, there are a lot of hotels in the area that are nicer. If I got a deal again, i'd probably stay. If I had to pay normal rates, i'd choose elsewhere. I don't quite see the fascination on TA about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: SaretaA
Reviews.Content: I and two other female friends, all in our late twenties, have just returned from a summer trip around France and Italy. We stayed at about 4 hotels during the trip and Hotel D'Albe was undoubtedly the best. The internet booking was easy and the staff were very helpful over email before we arrived. The rooms were a good size given the general size of Parisian hotel rooms, were soundproofed (important in the Latin quarter) with wonderful bathrooms. In general, the hotel was extremely well taken care of. Frankly for the price, both the hotel and its location are phenomenal: you can walk to Notre Dame in 5 minutes and to the Louvre in 15 mins. In summer you can walk over to the Paris Plage then back to your room to change for the evening. Also it had the best breakfast of any of the hotels we stayed at. Highly highly recommend. I am looking forward to staying there when I am next in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Cracking hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Scolsie
Reviews.Content: Myself and girlfriend stayed here for the second time this year, we will certainly stay again. The hotel is in a fantastic location with the metro and taxi rank only a stones throw away. It gets very busy around the hotel at night and have never had any problems sleeping, this time we did have a rear facing room (531) so didn't have any noise issues. The rooms are very tidy with an lcd tv, more than enough room for the 2 of us. The air conditioning was a god send when we went because it was very warm. My only minor niggles would be- lets have some English channels on the tv, seems like the only channels apart from (obviously) French channels are German and at breakfast the lovely lady who looks after breakfast clearly needs help in high season. When you come down she offers you orange juice (which should be self service surely) and tea or coffee, the trouble was the tables were covered in dirty plates etc where people had left and it was hard for one person to serve up tea and coffee whilst trying to clear tables, more often than not we'd almost finished when we got our coffee. If anyone asks us to recommend a Paris hotel I would without doubt tell them to go to Hotel D'Albe.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Frandsen
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel. We stayed for 5 nights. The service was excellent, friendly and helpful staff. It´s not the last time we stay at this hotel. Perfect location, near the Metro (We didn´t use the Metro at all, we didn´t have to.,) walking distance to a lot of Tourist attractions. Nice and clean rooms. We can only say nice things.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: maineyMelbourne
Reviews.Content: The Hotel had been recommended by my sister and for a girl travelling on her own , it was fantastic. Located in the heart of the Latin Quarter's restaurant district , it was perfect to eat out and walk safely to hotel , even at night . Needed to close window at night tho' cos can be noisy if you are an early to bed person. Breakfast was fabulous and lovely helpful staff. I felt very secure and like I was in a home away from home . Highly recommend it , especially if a female travelling alone , very secure yet allowed freedom to eat out at night in many places around it . R.R. Australia

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: BobGloucester
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Albe on a 3-day break. It was very clean, the beds were comfortable and our room was a decent size. We could even see the Seine from the window, the hotel being 5 minutes walk from Notre Dame Cathedral. The hotel is in the restaurant area of the left bank, with cheap and moderately priced restaurants from many different cuisines - we ate French, Tunisian and Egyptian. I imagine it could be noisy at weekends but during the week it was fine. It would be an excellent location for younger people, who don't go to bed too early! The hotel is 1 minute from St Michel metro station - with trains from Charles de Gaulle airport every 10 minutes, the journey takes about 40 minutes. The shops of Rue de Rivoli and the Louvre are within an easy walking distance but there are other shops nearby. The hotel has a lift - my only criticism would be that the corridors upstairs are a little narrow and dark. There was a mini bar in the room and a selection of toileteries. The flat screen TV was fine but only a couple of English channels. We didn't use the breakfast room, as there are plenty of cheaper cafes on Boulevard St Michel - but if you want breakfast in bed, then the option is there. It would have been excellent to have coffee/tea making facilities but that is rare in French hotels - however room service is available. The staff were extremely helpful and spoke English. We would definitely recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect location!!”
Reviews.Author: bobbie913
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights and had a wonderful experience. We had no problems with our room, which was very clean and loved the location. There was ample closet space and a great bathroom-- especially the shower. We were one block away from the subway, taxi and bus stop and just across the Sienne from Notre Dame. Couldn't have asked for a better hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: piggyinthemiddle1961
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Albe for four nights July 16-20 and were really delighted with the experience. We have two teenagers ages 14 and 16 and they also really liked the hotel. It is a very convenient and lively location, can't get closer to a metro stop than this place, and a short walk over the bridge takes you to St. Chapelle. There is a high concentration of various restaurants so that even the most finicky eater can find something to please them. The price for the quality of the rooms and wonderful front desk people was an excellent value. The front desk people were all very helpful, friendly and tolerated my rusty french but showed no disdain at speaking with me in their fluent english when my vocab ran out. We had two rooms, each with balcony from which we could see the river and the lively street scene below. The only caution would be that we seemed to have a family of elephants staying above us and the walls were not extremely soundproof but we had no trouble at all getting a good nights sleep. The rooms and bathrooms were sparkling clean with thick fluffy towels. We had breakfast at the boulangerie right beside the hotel and I do miss the pain chocolat already! I highly recommend this hotel and would return there if given another vacation opportunity in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel d'Albe OOH-LA LA!”
Reviews.Author: Marcster
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked our summer vacation trip to Paris and the Hotel d'Albe via the internet without any problems whatsoever. I stayed at the Hotel d' Albe thirty years ago and remembered my stay as a pleasure. The rates were very reasonable. The staff assisted us with making anniversary reservations for lunch at the Eiffel Tower, the Eurostar to London, Open Top Bus Tour and confirmed our return air reservations. I was very impressed with the staff's support and professionalism in every respect. They made every effort to insure our expectations were met. The room was a little small as we expected but the location was the best place from which to start our days. The central air was quiet and worked very well. The dual paned windows insured that the noise of the street never interrupted our sleep. I would recommend the Hotel d'Albe to anyone who likes to travel and desires a Parisian hotel instead of the "chain style" variety. The Latin Qtr. is the best area to stay in Paris for a vacation because it's always busy; old world streets, lots of places to eat (Rue De Buci area across Place St MIchel seemed to have nicer, more relaxed places to eat with talented street muscians). I'd do my trip exactly as we did it all over again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: csully928
Reviews.Content: Small hotel with excellent rooms in the Latin quarter district. Across from Notre-Dame, along the Seine, and close, 800 meters, to the Louvre. Very clean. Next to subway station, direct line from de Gaulle airport. This was my first time in Paris, so I don't have much to compare. But the location was convenient. In the morning went jogging along the Seine down to the Eiffel tower. Fabulous views along the river. Some of the rooms overlook a plaza which gets very crowded and noisy till the early morning hours. Not a problem with the windows closed, but if you want complete peace and quiet ask for a room along a back street.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cleule22
Reviews.Content: We had one of the best rooms of this hotel. We had a very excellent view on the very lively street. The location was great as well. The only shortcoming was that breakfast was not included although the room was very pricy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: nanogram
Reviews.Content: Location, location, Location! When you're in a big city like Paris you're better off in the path rather than off it because you'll be doing a lot of walking to get to the places you want to get to. Hotel Albe is in a great spot in the Latin Quarter. The hotel has 6 stories. We stayed on the 5th floor. We had a small balcony that provided a great opportunity to sit and watch the crowd at night. Rooms were typically small but modern and clean. A great value for your money. Skip the hotel breakfast. Go outside and get a crepe or pastries. There are many options outside your door. Unfortunately no coffee maker is provided. Skip all the restaurants outside your door when it comes to other meals though. They are all tourist traps. Chances are if in front of the restaurant their are enormous boards showcasing each page of their prix-fixe menu it won't be worth it. Head off the beaten path where you are bound to find some excellent options. If you don't like to walk, the metro station is right outside your door. Also there is a batobus which makes stops along the Seine River to landmarks such as the Eiffel Tower and the Louvre. They have day passes. Skip taxis since Paris public transportation system is very easy to navigate. Save yourself some money if you are coming from CDG airport as for 2 euro you can hop on the RER B line to St Michel Station. It only takes about 35 minutes. Also if you are catching a TGV or Eurostar train at Gare Du Nord for your next destination take the #4 train. It's only a few stops and you'll get their in 15 minutes. Oh yeah, and don't worry about the noise at night. The soundproofing is superb!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great place”
Reviews.Author: Ilivedthere
Reviews.Content: I had a most enjoyable stay at hotel d'albe. The receptionist, Cyrile was brilliant, the breakfast lady was excellent, the room was great, facilities good. The only minor issue was the non-availability of tea and coffee in the rooms - but I understand that this is a European "thing". Also, there were no British-based TV programs - everything was a little too American. I'd rate the overall experience as excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price”
Reviews.Author: jacadi
Reviews.Content: We visit France/Paris 3-4 times per year for business/pleasure staying at various 3-5 star hotels in various areas& the Hotel D'Albe rates among the top 10. This trip was with our teenage children [2- 16 & 18] in their own room & our room both on the 5th. floor. Surprise, our early arrival found the rooms ready & waiting [a first]compared to other hotels. The front desk was cooperative & pleasant. The rooms were cozy & quite adequate with a small balcony for taking in the grea weather [another first] & viewing the action below. The breakfast [included] was substantial & a good start to the day. The lady that served the breakfast was outstanding, friendly, cheerful & extremely efficient combine her efforts with the room maids who brought the rooms back to a civilized environment & this hotel with its location & its joie de vivre rates a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: SheffieldCatface
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel situated very close to the Metro / RER and within easy walking distance of the Notre Dame. The room was a reasonable size, very clean and well looked after during our stay. There was a spacious bathroom and a modern flatscreen tv with excellent reception, plus air con. We did not eat in the hotel. There is an excellent patiserrie next door which served lovely coffee, croissants etc at reasonable prices and where you can eat outside and sample Paris streetlife. Unfortunately, could not recommend eating in any resaurants nearby. This area is something of a tourist trap and do not think that you get good quality or good value food in many of these restaurants . Would recommend that you search elsewhere for the legendary Paris cuisine. The area is also pricey for bar drinks etc, however, you cannot really expect otherwise in such a central location. Because of the central location, this is a very busy area at night and can be noisy, although the double galzed windows were very effective. The staff were courteous at all times. Overall, throughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel location and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Norjan
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a perfect location in Paris (nearby everything) and the staff is really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Highly Recommend this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RTORTOIT
Reviews.Content: I used TripAdvisor to choose a hotel, and the good reviews were pretty much on the money. This is a great little hotel in the Latin Quarter with a location that is really hard to beat; one block to Metro, the Seine, can walk to Louvre, Musee D'Orsay (didn't have to, but they were pleasant walks). It isn't the least costly, but for the location and the amenities well worth it. Clean and very modern bathrooms, excellent maid service. The best part about it is the street life you can view from the balcony. Noise is definitely a factor, if you are a light sleeper or picky about noise, choose a room on the top floors or go somewhere else; occasionally there is a hip hop performance going on until 10:00 pm. We had no problem with it, loved being lulled to sleep by a very well paid classical guitar a couple of nights, and thought the buzz of human activity down there was great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean with perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: bcenough
Reviews.Content: You could not ask for a better location to explore Paris from! If you like to walk and just enjoy the ambience of Paris, this location is perfect. If you'd rather take the metro to popular attractions, there are three metro stops very close to the hotel, including the train to Versailles. The room was kept very clean and the staff was very nice and spoke English very well. We'd stay here again and would recommend the Albe to all !

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel stay for Australians”
Reviews.Author: Denlo
Reviews.Content: Australians, this hotel is perfect. I can't tell you just how pleased we were with this hotel and the locale. Rooms are clean and well kept. beds comfortable. quiet aircon., windows are double glazed. convenient to everything.Better than the photos. there is a small supermarket behind the hotel, and a large Printemps supermarket across square from St Severins.( a 5 minutes walk or less once you have found it, Good food. ). Look for the red 'Printemps' neon sign. There is plenty of street activity around the hotel and both sides of the Place St Michel, and lots of restaurants. There are 2 Banks on the other side of Place St Michel with 24Hr ATMs which take Aust Visa/ Mastercard if you need more money. You can walk to most tourist sites from here, or take the metro. Catch the RER from C de Gaul airport- 4 stops. The Hotel is behind the bookstore with the yellow awning. Take exit 4 from the RER station. I would recommend this to anyone, and will stay here next time. No tea or coffee in rooms but you can get one at the excellent bakery downstairs on the corner. We found the area to be safe ,as Central Police station is just across the bridge over the Seine. D.B Wollongong NSW

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem in vibey part of Paris”
Reviews.Author: KayDeeCT_SouthAfrica
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us by a family member who had stayed there many times before. It has a lovely feel to it, is very reasonably proced and is in a fantastically vibrant and lively part of Paris. The staff were friendly and helpful and the rooms were well kept and very comfortable. Only complaint was that our room was not ready for us when we arrived (after check-in time) but staff remedied that by allocating us another room. Would definitely recommend this.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: ducks062
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 3, 2 adults, one teenager. The location of this hotel is central to most sights and activities in the city as expressed in other comments. The hotel staff were all very helpful during our stay. They are diligent with security, which was comforting considering the crowds out at night in the streets directly below. The room was compact, but efficient and very clean. We would most definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location & Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Romannot
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 days on our way to the Loire Valley. The location is superb - steps away from the Metro & RER, Notre Dame, and the Seine boat tours. The staff was very friendly, letting us check in early on arrival. They even walked me through the Metro station to purchase tickets for the rail system out of Paris. Great dining & good shopping in the vicinity. Wish we'd stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: vacmn
Reviews.Content: Clean! Great Location! Superb Staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: h111
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in June and had a lovely time. Was in the junior suite which was very clean, had a huge bathroom and 2 plasma tv's! Location is very convenient for first-time visitors as metro station just a minute's walk away. Many restaurants to chose from right at hotel's doorstep, though most are rather touristy. Only downside is the noise factor as restaurants & bars downstairs stay open till 1 or 2am so the noise doesn't die down until then. Would stay again with friends but probably not with older family members looking for a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: geckoRhodeIsland
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortable and clean. I was surprised that we didn't hear the street noise from our second floor room. The hotel is close to a couple of Metro stations, and mere blocks away from Notre Dame. The staff was pleasant and helpful. My husband wanted to book train tickets (with our american credit card) and there were problems. One of the staff actually went with him to the metro (right around the corner) and showed him exactly what he'd have to do to get the tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Pick Paris”
Reviews.Author: touringmom
Reviews.Content: Perfect location to see Paris, walking distance to Louvre and Notre Dame, and the St. Michel metro stop is a block away. The Hotel was charming in a very modern way. For our family of thee adults, the room was very comfortable. The staff was extremely helpful for tourists who don't speak French- and very patient with us! We would stay there again, and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ric-J
Reviews.Content: Picked the hotel based on location and reviews from this site. It was a great place for our first visit to Paris. Got to the hotel early using the RER directly from CDG to the St Michel station, just a few easy steps from the hotel. Our 4th floor room was already clean and a ready welcome after an long overnight flight from California. The room was clean, a nice size for two and the bathroom was very clean and large, especially the deep tub and shower. Our room was quiet, thanks to the double pane windows even with some construction activity across the street. We took advantage of the bakery downstairs instead of the breakfast in the hotel. Could easly walk to so many places such as the Louvre, Notre Dame, River Seine, all the wonderful streets and restaurants in the Latin Quarter and the Metro just a few steps away. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value great position”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideDayTripper
Reviews.Content: Small but efficient and comfortable rooms with everything required. Excellent position just around the corner from Notre Dame in the middle of the Latin quarter and a very short walk from St Michel metro. If you are a good walker then the louvre is also in reach.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: JimmyGlass
Reviews.Content: We liked the hotel for its very nice, up-to-date rooms at a very reasonable price. The location is near the RER with direct trains to CDG. The hotel is located on a pedestrianized street which was very active, very full of life, with tourists and students everywhere. The nearby streets were filled with an astounding collection of restaurants and cafes of nearly every cuisine I can think of, from Tibetan to tapas. The hotel is also close to the Metro, but because the street is pedestrian, we had a hard time getting from the Gare de Lyon in a taxi, only because the the cabbie didn't recognize the address. Despite all the activity outside, the room was well soundproofed. The room, while not huge, was more than adequate with comfortable furniture and with a bathroom recently installed and one of the best we've had in France. The only downsides that I could see were very minor. The breakfast was not cheap and we did better eating in cafes. But it is convenient and the hostess was very pleasant. The desk staff was generally helpful with good restaurant recommendations etc., but seemed a little put out by having to reserve us a shuttle to the airport when we left. Maybe I caught the clerk at a bad moment; he certainly came through for us without a hitch.

Reviews.Title: “amazing location!!!”
Reviews.Author: sheabutter
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel based on the comments from this site and they were bang on. I will not bother repeating them just simply put, it was clean, excellent location, great helpful at service desk and good price considering all the other hotels I compared with price and stars.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the price.”
Reviews.Author: sdjlindsay
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel through Tripadvisor, and I think the positive reviews are accurate. The hotel is on the edge of the Latin Quarter and St. Germain des Pres, so you can easily explore both neighborhoods without getting on the Metro. I stayed in a double room, which I think had plenty of space. The flat screen TV was a nice touch. There was adequate closet space for the clothes I brought as I was there on business for the week. I thought reception was very friendly and professional. In general, I have no complaint with this hotel. If you want the amenities of the Ritz, you will need to spend more money. This is not rocket science. For this price, I believe you would be hard-pressed to find a better hotel in such a prime location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ilwelo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located. My girlfriend and I were able to take the train from the airport to the hotel in 30 minutes without transfer. And the hotel is only one block away from the station. The area is nice and lively, and very close to very thing. It is a 5 to 10 mins walk to Notre Dame. There are many restaurants and people around all the time. The room was small, but very clean and new. We have a view of the Seine River. The receptionists all speak English very well. I will definitely recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: benksy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my elderly parents. Even though it was right in the busiest part of the latin quarter, it was so well insulated that none of us could here a thing at night, once the windows were closed. And the crowd of people outside in the evening was well behaved, not like your typical lager louts in England at all! I couldn't fault the place. The staff were efficient and polite, the rooms were well furnished and very clean, with plenty of space. The lift was big enough for us all to get in at once, (just). I loved it, and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Dave_Kansas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Albe for five nights and were very pleased with the accomodations. The hotel has been renovated and is clean, modern and comfortable. While the rooms are small by US standards, they are well-appointed. The windows are new and double-glazed; a great deal of the street noise is blocked. The staff is patient, helpful and gracious. The best way to establish a relationship with them is to try to use at least some rudimentary French. They respond well to such efforts. The hotel is a block away from Place St Michel and the Seine; a great location in the heart of the action. Perhaps the best feature is the small bakery next door - superb croissants and coffee. We would return to the Albe without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: weezz
Reviews.Content: Location location location - Great location - the train direct from Charles De Gaulle delivers you to a station exit within 50 meters of the door. We were concerned when we heard that Parisian hotels are small small small. This room was perfectly adequate sizewise and from the layout map ours certainly was one of the smaller but had a large bathroom. The room was spotlessly clean and the staff friendly at all times. Another of the good features was the recently installed double glazing which ensured we had the best sleeps of our trip in this hotel. Up between 8 and 8.30 and out the door at about 9 for breakfast next door or one of many cafes in the area. We can advise that room 430 has a view of the Seine. We will be back and hoping that this gem is still available at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: TravelarAtHeart
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a trip to Paris and Milan. We spent three days in Paris at the Hotel Albe. I picked the hotel from the trip advisor website. The descriptions were very accurate. Hotel Albe is in the St. Germain area and within walking distance to many of the Paris attractions. This area is very lively and noisy. There is always something going on till the wee morning hours. There is a cafe next door which has great pastries for a reasonable price. We did not try the hotel breakfast. There are many other ethnic type cafes, resturants, and shops too. There is even an Internet cafe down the street for those of you who need to be connected for work or pleasure. The hotel does not offer wireless Internet hook-up in the rooms. The hotel room is very clean and neat. They are small but roomy enough. We had a triple room and it was managable to move around and even store our luggage. The bathroom was nice with a shower/bath, however don't plan on standing to take a shower because there is no door just a half class wall and the water tended to spray out onto the floor. There was enough hot water for all three of us and glad to have a hair dryer so we didn't have to pack one of our own. The only drawback from our room was that it was located at the front of the hotel on the 2nd floor. It was noisy at night. However, the noise was part of the experience of staying in this area of Paris. The reception desk was helpful and courteous. I would stay in this hotel again, if we ever go back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great time!”
Reviews.Author: mtnmanUSA
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the great location and proximity to the sites and to the Metro. We arrived at the Paris Nord rail station, and after only 2 RER stops, we stepped out practically in front of the hotel. I would recommend trying to get a room on one of the upper floors because the streets at night can be a little noisy. We were above the fray. The staff was helpful and friendly, and the room, though small, was clean and comfortable. We will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A Haven in the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Rundle12
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay at the Albe( myself, my wife and our 5 yr old daughter). The corner room we had on the second floor was lovely with 3 single beds(2 pushed together), a nice clean modern bathroom and a qaint small balcony from which you can just see the Seine. Compared to the price of other central hotels, the Hotel is on par with its solid 3* to 4* rating. Our rate was 209 euros per night booked directly with the hotel. As mentioned in other reviews, the hotel is in a very noisy area, but the room is remarkably soundproof keeping out all but the occasional faint drone of the crowds below. The close proximity to the Metro is a huge bonus. While we certainly enjoyed the buzz of the area, we might choose a quieter location next time simply for a change of scenery. Other than the fact that the air conditioning could have kept the room a little cooler at night and the front desk staff could have been a little warmer, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: YYZgurl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great value for money as far as location and close proximity to major attractions such as Notre Dame 2-3min away and the Louvre about 10min walk. I stayed here with my two daughters. They too found nightlife very good. St Germain and St Michel is the main intersection and many shops and cafes all around. This is the heart of Paris. With many cafes at your door step!!!!This hotel is located in a small cobblestone street where restuarants cafes and shop are located. Never a dull moment to people watch at your balcony. Every night there was always entertainment at the corner street of St Michel... buskers and break dancers, live singers. The staff spoke very good english and very accommodating too. Jacques was very helpful in recommending restaurants and sights to see. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with friendly staff in one of the nicest neighbourhoods of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Movemania
Reviews.Content: The Albe hotel in the Quartier Latin neighbourhood is a very nice hotel at a super location and with relatively spacious rooms (given it's Paris). Nice atmosphere, both in the hotel and in the surroundings. Lively nightlife (one night when we returned at our hotel, there were thre guys playing guitar and singing with the audience singing alone, Great!) and a lot of things to do (including good eating and drinking at reasonable prices). Would go there again when in paris next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: ardnaree
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights and were not disappointed. The hotel was clean and the service was friendly. We had booked a superior room at a small extra cost because we had heard that hotel rooms in Paris tend to be very small - this got us an average sized room which was fine. The great thing about this hotel is its location - on a street with restaurants and plenty of atmosphere and in a good area with the Latin Quarter, St Germain & the Seine islands within easy walking distance. Also the metro/RER station is within yards of the hotel with a direct line to CDG airport We had read the site reviews prior to booking and feel that the number of good reviews are justified, from our experience. We had breakfast in the cafe next door which was a cheaper option than the Hotel breakfast. There are some lovely restaurants within easy walking distance - we didn't use the ones outside the hotel, which appeared to be tourist-oriented but found some slightly futher afield - the Petit Prince in the Rue de Lanneau is worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Plush Comfort”
Reviews.Author: JonesieLinthicum
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only one night, because our other hotel was sold out for our last night in Paris. After a week in budget accomodations, we felt like we were in the lap of luxury staying here. We were given a twin room on the fifth floor. Imagine our surprise to be given a room with a balcony! We were not expecting it and we were thrilled. The room was very comfortable, with an upscale, modern vibe. The flat screen tv was impressive, although , not being fans of tv, it was probably wasted on us. The bathroom was sleek and ultra-modern, with a large walk-in shower stall with floor-to ceiling tile and a slate floor. The sound-proofing was excellent. We stayed on a warm spring Saturday night, where the street below featured wall-to-wall people, but we slept soundly. The beds were extremely comfortable. Our room was not ready at noon when we arrived, so we left our luggage sitting out in the lobby with everyone else's. It didn't bother us, but the more paranoid among you should be aware. We also left our key at the front desk when the room was not occupied. Again, I know that drives some people crazy, but that's just the way it is here. I've been coming to Paris for 35 years and have never had one thing stolen. The breakfast was not particularly elaborate and struck me as overpriced, but that is a minor quibble. I should mention that the lady who served it could not have been nicer. We chose the hotel for its proximity to the RER to the airport, and it served our purposes well. Treat yourself-just look at the dollar's weakening value and be prepared to pay the price!

Reviews.Title: “disappointed with Hotel D'Albe”
Reviews.Author: MGAR
Reviews.Content: Shabby,small room , very badly in need of re-decoration, corridors also shabby and very tight. Wafer thin walls between bedrooms - very noisy. Reception area very limited. Have stayed in Paris hotels at half the price for twice the value. Great vibrant location v. near Notre Dame. Will never return!!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: NewSmyrnaBeach
Reviews.Content: My wife, son (12) and I just spent 5 nights at the Hotel D'Albe. It was truly our best experience in Paris yet. You could not ask for a better location in Paris. The room was clean and plenty big enough for the three of us. It's a lively and safe area. The Latin Quarter is our favorite area for that very reason. The bakery down stairs fit the bill in the mornings and outside they served up some killer ham and cheese and a big assortment of panini's and crêpes for later on. All in all you just can't do better than the Hotel D'Albe.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time at This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: unreal32
Reviews.Content: 6 months after our first trip to Paris, we went back again. Stayed at Hotel D'Albe for the second time, and loved it even more. The hotel upgraded us to a nicer room, and all I can say is oh. my. god. It was gorgeous. The most striking thnig was the bathroom, with beautiful tile, mirrors and lighting. The bathroom was quite large by European standards. Even by American standards. And the room itself was great. The hotel was nice enough to lend me a laptop, and I used it to surf the Internet from the comfort of my room. Hotel staff were extremely friendly. Great location, at the edge of the Latin Quarter. I'm so glad I found this hotel. This is the perfect hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel”
Reviews.Author: trioptron
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at this hotel. It is clean and has a friendly atmosphere and it is very centrally located. I would consider it as good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, ordinary service”
Reviews.Author: Jeremyh
Reviews.Content: Yes, this is a good location, but the hotel itself is nothing special, and, in my view, overpriced for what you get. The staff were not particularly helpful, and the room, while clean, was pretty small, with ridiculously small storage space, no tea or coffee making facilities, not even any shampoo provided (and there was a HIDEOUS painting on the wall)! The breakfast was, at best, mediocre, and we suffered from a ridiculous rule of only one key per room - when I inadvertently went out with the key, my wife was unable to leave the room until I returned because they refused access to another key if she left. The room was also far too cold, and the "heating" system was inoperative when we wanted to warm it up. For 185 euros a night (including their requirement for a full night's tariff when we arrived at 7.30 am), it's just not good value for mine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: edstraker123
Reviews.Content: Just returned from another stay at the Hotel D'Albe and once again had a fabulous time. The Hotel had been refurbished since our last visit and looked very tidy indeed. The room whilst being quite small was very comfortable and spotlessly clean. The location of the Hotel is second to none, being only a stone's throw from Notre Dame and a few metres from the St Michel metro station ensuring easy access from the Airport via RER or to any of the wonderful sights of Paris.For those who like to travel round Paris on foot - the main sites are within easy access : Musee d'Orsay, Jardin de Luxembourg or even the Eiffel tower for the fitter walker. Being set in the heart of the vibrant Latin Quarter also means that there are plenty of places to eat and drink of an evening as well as being well placed for just soaking up the atmosphere and watching the many street entertainers around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa821
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Hotel D'Albe over Easter break. The hotel lived up to all the fastastic reviews. You can't beat the location (right outside of the St. Michel Metro stop). We were able to walk to most attractions. We were also able to take the RER directly to Charles de Gaulle with our luggage right from St. Michel. The rooms were extremely clean and the staff was helpful, but not always accurate when giving local information. The hotel is located on a busy pedestrian street with musicians and singers right outside. We were surprised how quiet our room was when we closed the window. Great soundproofing! I would not hestitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: loumcgarry
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay in Paris in the Hotel d'Albe. Whatever downsides this hotel may have, it's location is second to none. You really couldn't ask for a better location and their sound proofed windows really do work! I couldn't say i really have any complaints about the hotel as such. As always in Paris the rooms are compact! Though I have stayed in smaller. I am not sure about the extra price we paid to change from a double to a twin room, given the twin was 2 small single beds pushed together anyway - and there wasn't room to separate them even if you wanted to. Otherwise, the hotel was great and not somewhere you didn't want to go back to at night. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it. Though just remember the pictures do make all hotels look better than they are.

Reviews.Title: “Great view”
Reviews.Author: SMHansen
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in the center of the latin quarter in Paris. Lots of restaurants sourrounding the hotel. Lots of people in the streets at night, playing music having fun. From our room we could see the Louvre and Seine-river. And there was almost no noice in the room, even at night. Perfect. Excellent bathroom - not very big, but in a very good condition. Great breakfast, and kind service. (A little bit expensive, but it was a buffet, with all you can eat) The Metro and RER train station lies only 25 meters from the hotel. About 200 meters to the Notre Dame Cathedral. We will definately come back another time...

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Quality/Value”
Reviews.Author: santo10019
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Hotel d'Albe recently. Overall a very good hotel, from a value/quality perspective. Very clean room, quite small as usual in Paris, but not a problem - very modern amenities, including the nice plasma tv with extra cable channels (e.g. Canal + Sport, allowing me to view the Masters last Saturday, an important consideration!). Nice location, just steps from Notre Dame Cathedral and the nice areas of Quartier Latin to the east and St Germain des Pres to the west.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: MetteNorway
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel and think the location of the hotel is the best area to tay in Paris. Rooms are very nice with big windows so you get good view to the nice streets below.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel especially the location”
Reviews.Author: Visitor_Dublin
Reviews.Content: We are three women from Dublin just back from a 3 night stay at the Albe Hotel in Paris and will definitely stay and recommend to all our friends in the future. The hotel although not huge, is very clean and adequate for our needs. The reception staff were extremely helpful in supplying us with directions and also looked after our luggage while we went shopping, as we had a late flight back in the evening. Although the breakfast is not included its worth paying the €13, as it can be more expensive to eat elsewhere. Carmel, who looked after us in the morning was really pleasant and could not be more helpful. We stayed in room 427 which was one of the bigger rooms. It was spotless and towels and bed linen were changed every day. The bathroom although not huge was and adequate size and looked as if it had been recently refurbished. The best thing about the hotel was the location. It is in the Latin Quarter, which is full of atmosphere both in the afternoon and particularly in the evening. We travelled by RER directly from Charles De Gaulle to the St. Michelle Metro Station which is just 20yards from the Hotel. Due to the convenient location, we used the Metro every day. You can also get the RER train from here to the Palace of Verseilles , it takes about 40 mins. and you can purchase your entrance ticket along with your rail ticket at the station. But be warned, you may still have to queue to get into the Palace. It took us an hour to get in, but the line was moving all the time and the weather was good. The bus stop is also just beside the Metro Station which will bring you over to Galeries LaFayette for some shopping. The Hotel is also just over the bridge from Notre Dame Cathedral. You can get the open deck bus, hop on hop off, which costs €22 and is valid for two days. Well worth the price and a great idea for getting familiar with the city. It was my third visit to the city and I hope to be back again in a few years. I'll definitely be staying at the Albe Hotel. The only downside was we were unable to check in until 3:00 p.m. However, the staff explained that the previous occupants had a young child, so we did not mind this. They held onto our luggage while we had a coffee and a wander around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lanzachic
Reviews.Content: Myself and two friends stayed at the Albe from 28th -30th Mar 07. Great little hotel..We stayed in a triple room..rooms are small but fine..we didn't spend much time there...spotlessly clean...bathroom small but spotless.Breakfast was great for €6...the lady in the breakfast room was extremely friendly,couldn't do enough for us..Hotel situated in the center of everything...great location...close to the metro,lots of restaurants bars & shops in the vicinity & notre dame is just around the corner..Receptionist very helpful also...Would definitely recommend this hotel & we will be booking there in sept for our next trip..

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: traveler_pp
Reviews.Content: Great service, great location, steps away from Metro stop that is on a good line and has direct RER airport service. Price very reasonable. Can't ask for much more. Saw that someone else mentioned noise -- the neighborhood is fairly noisy, but the windows are thick and appear new. Perhaps a recent upgrade -- noise wasn't a problem and room faced the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Hotel D'Albe St. Michel.”
Reviews.Author: stats74
Reviews.Content: This hotel was at a great location, about a block from the metro, but was also within walking distance of Notre Dame and great cafes and restaurants. The room was standard size from what I've seen in European cities, but absolutely immaculate, especially the bathroom. The hotel staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay at this hotel again the next time I'm in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful first experience”
Reviews.Author: HBMC
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel in a perfect location in Paris! The rooms (at least on the 5th floor where I was) themselves are clean, more or less quiet, spacious enough, fairly new. The bathrooms are all new and impeccably clean. The staff was courteous and spoke good enough English to communicate with easily. We did not eat in the restaurant as there are so many other restaurants in the area to choose from, but the menu looked nice and so did the breakfast, from what we saw. The price was also fair considering you are mere blocks away from Notre Dame, the Seine, the Isle de France, and all the other attractions over there. You are also in the middle of the lovely winding old streets of the Quartier Latin with wonderful restaurants and bars also reasonably priced. I will definitely stay there again the next time I am in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “weekend off with my sons”
Reviews.Author: StefanSweden
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the fantastic team at the hotel, friendly, helpful and filled with own initatives in servicing us as guests - and allways with a smile - we had a fantastic post spring weekend in Paris. Our warmest thanks, Stefan, Tim & Erik

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Scotia39
Reviews.Content: Simple, clean, efficiant hotel in an ideal location for restaurants and attractions. Metro nearby too. Stayed there with family and also for a rugby weekend. One word of warning.....don't go to Aarapana Indian Restaurant nearby. It was dreadful!

Reviews.Title: “Albe'back”
Reviews.Author: SCastello
Reviews.Content: The Hotel D'Albe is a gem of a hotel for a number of reasons. I didn't expect anything special from this 3 star accommodation as it was booked as a last minuite solution for the France v Scotland rugby weekend I had planned. The location of the hotel is perfect, just around the corner from Notre Dame. The hotel is slightly inset from the main road in a cobbled area within the "latin quarter" which is quietly bustling during the day with parisian shops, some lovely small cafes and restaurants. The metro is only 20 yards away for all your other sightseeing needs. On entry to the hotel it was clean and immaculate, with a geniunely friendly welcome. Although small, the room was situated on the top floor and had a separate toilet and washroom. There was ample cupboard space, comfy beds and I was suprised to find a mini fridge that contained a nice selection of beer and bottled water (that was to save me later on) at a relatively cheap price for a minibar. There was also a state of the art flatscreen TV to watch so that I could brush up on the Francais! Not at all bad for a 3 star place and at a fantastic cost for a weekend. Unfortunately it was not such a great rugby experience but with regards to the hotel, all I can say is .........Albe'back!!!! Steven "the referee gave France the win"

Reviews.Title: “Good but noisy”
Reviews.Author: superdreen
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from four days at this hotel,staying in a first floor room. The only thing that spolit our stay was the noise from the street. If we kept our windows closed it was ok, but as the weather was warm we wanted to keep the windows open at night. As it is still officially winter, the heating was on instead of the air conditioning. So we either had to roast at night (even though we turned the heating off) or suffer the noise from the street. Our first night was a Saturday and the noise went on well into 3 am. The street cleaners etc came around at about 5.30 am. I would go back to this hotel as it was as good as the recommendations said (WONDERFUL shower!) but in future I would ask for a quieter room or go when the air conditioning is on!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in the heart of the Latin Quarters”
Reviews.Author: adejesus007
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly and very helpful staff. I will definitely be returning. Thanks!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place to stay”
Reviews.Author: nataliahorruitiner
Reviews.Content: Ill be honest Im not one to write reviews, but this is an Ideal hotel to stay at if you are looking for a central place. Train station is 30 sec walk and notre dame is a 10 min walk. My fiance and I wanted a clean clean clean place to stay at but we werent looking for anything fancy. We only had 4days to really get to know Paris. Located in the middle of 100's of restaurants and bars we felt that we had chosen the perfect place. I recommened the green line tour buses even if you dont want to listen to their tour guide (earphone thingamagigs) its ideal as a a taxi. For 2 day tickets its around $45euros and for a day its around $40. It runs throught out all major attractions. The hotel staff is friendly. Their is an AWESOME bakery attached to the hotel (cheaper and better than breakfast at hotel) Great place if you are not looking for a RItz.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: powellies
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a quick, overnight stay with my teenage daughter at this great little hotel in Paris. Having read the reviews, we requested a room with a view and with a bathroom and shower. We had a twin room on the fifth floor, with a wonderful view towards the Seine from a small balcony. The room wasn't large, but plenty big enough for us and had a mini bar, flatscreen tv and safe. The decor was simple and modern, and to our taste. The beds were comfortable. Again, although small (including a shorter length bath), the bathroom was sparklingly clean and modern which for me is more important, with plenty of hot water. The entrance lobby was bright, modern and clean, with some welcoming leather seating and magazines. We arrived early, and the hotel offered to store our bags. Our room was ready by 12.30pm. It was warm in the daytime even in March, but this allowed us to have the windows open. Not sure about how it would be in the heat of the summer (see other reviews). The staff were wonderfully helpful, and gave a very good restaurant recommendation - always a test. We opted for breakfast in the boulangerie next door, as recommended by other reviews. Great idea! Bargain price for a pain au chocolat and cafe americain which you can take away or have sitting down. It was warm enough to sit outside so we didn't want to sit inside in the hotel restaurant. Also saves a few Euros and some space for a long, lunch! Yes, it's not the quietest location, and if you want a peaceful night then choose somewhere else. But we wanted a bit of buzz and got it! My 17 year-old daughter loved the area with its small shops and noisy bars and clubs - even down to the smashing of plates by waiters trying to tempt you into the greek restaurants! It did get a little roudy later on on Saturday night, but we found it amusing and entertaining rather than worrying. Something to sit and watch whilst lingering over a coffee and crepe in the bar on the opposite corner. Lots of street 'performers'. Not sure it would be quite so lively during the week... Also, you're so near so many other places - especially if you don't mind walking - that we agreed the price was very good for the location: right by the Seine, on the edge of St Germain, across the river from Notre Dame and onto les Halles and the Pompidou, and a walk along the river over the Pont Neuf and on to the Louvre. Plus, a direct RER link to Charles de Gaulle airport and elsewhere just a few steps away, a great bonus when you're lugging luggage. We would definitely stay again. Thank you to all those reviewers who helped us make the right decision!

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: tmattuk
Reviews.Content: Really good value for money. Excellent position...5 mins walk from Notre Dame and the Seine. Walm, and particularly quiet, our room faced an inner courtyard,and with quality refurbishment we felt very comfortable. Staff very helpful too. Can really recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Recommended”
Reviews.Author: treezaSheffield
Reviews.Content: Stayed 23rd-26th Feb. Good location, close to metro. Notra Dame a few minutes walk away. Loads of restaurants, roadside crepe stalls, Greek food outlets etc. close by. Very lively at night (only downside to the stay was the noise at night ). Breakfast buffet good - this was included in room rate.Room not too large but adequate for a few nights and very clean. Took us ages to get from CDG airport, via the RER underground, to the hotel - we caught the metro on a bad day. For anyone who has never done this trip before, it may help to know that you need to go down to the Departures level in CDG airport (i.e. the ground floor, 1 floor down from arrivals) and then go outside and catch the free shuttle bus to Terminal 3 (the bus was Line 2). The RER metro can be found inside the building at terminal 3 - the ticket to Paris central costs 8.10 euros one way and there are only a couple of ticket offices - hence a massive queue. Or you can be brave and buy a ticket from a machine.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: AlexanderG
Reviews.Content: Very good location on Place St. Michel. Rooms average in size but clean and well kept. The street noise mentioned by some reviewers could be a concern for older travellers but for me it was not a problem. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Super spot.”
Reviews.Author: dixmith
Reviews.Content: A super location for just about everything central in Paris. Staff very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Spot On & Spotless”
Reviews.Author: circa1962
Reviews.Content: Not one to write these types of reviews generally but would like to leave a few comments on the Hotel D'Albe ( Rue De La Harpe ) as accommodation in city centres can often be hit and miss. Went with my wife and my parents for short break via Eurostar to celebrate my mother's 70th birthday and can only say experience was superb. Staff were very helpful with all travel ,restaurant and river cruise bookings - as said location ideal,premises were very clean and would definitely recommend to any friends/family in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Albe Back!!”
Reviews.Author: B6IRL
Reviews.Content: Just returned back from another fantastic stay at Hotel D'Albe right in the heart of the Latin Quarter. We discovered the hotel during our last stay in Paris. The Hotel is a stones throw away from St Michel Metro but despite it's central location, right in the heart of 'the biz', the sound proofing is fantastic, although you do tend to spend most of the time with your window open to let in all the fabulous sounds and smells. The staff are very friendly and accommodating and will allow you to muddle your way through your limited French before rescuing you with their far better English! We booked directly with the hotel and as we had stayed before requested a high floor. We were allocated a good sized room on the 5th floor with plasma TV, mini bar and a balcony that had views over the Sienne & it's many bridges - the perfect place to sit with a glass of wine planning our days & nights expeditions. We also had breakfast included in our stay but with the many Boulangeries & Patisseries in and around the area we tended to eat out most of the time. Not to take anything away from the hotel breakfast tho, the breakfast room is very bright & pleasant with a good selection of cereals, toast, cheeses & of course pastries but we would probably leave this out next time. The only down side to our stay was that there was some refurbishment going on in the lower floors and the bumps and bangs could be heard from earlyish morning till early evening, but for the hotel to keep the standard that it has set then these works have to get done at some point and it certainly wasn't enough of a set back to spoil an otherwise flawless stay. We would have no hesitation in recommending Hotel D'Albi and are planning to visit again very soon

Reviews.Title: “Albe Hotel est parfait!”
Reviews.Author: eastcoastsoul
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I recently returned from our first European trip. The Hotel d'Albe St. Michel is everything we could have hoped for in a Parisian hotel: a cozy room with French doors opening onto a perfect view of the Seine (which is right across the street!); two Metro stations literally steps from the front door; patisserie and creperie right next door; cafes, the Louvre and Notre Dame all in reasonable walking distance. But, really, besides the incredible location, it is their staff that made our trip so memorable. Alexandre was a friendly, helpful, sometimes calming presence at reception. He graciously provided recommendations, directions, assistance. I almost don't want to write such a positive review for fear that the next time I come to Paris the Hotel d'Albe will be booked solid. Yet, I wish them nothing but success. Go. Stay at the Hotel d'Albe. Fall in love with Paris and this adorable little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location loved it”
Reviews.Author: truthfulreview
Reviews.Content: We visited for a romantic weekend and is was everything we wanted. ( I am quite fussy) Not overly expensive, excellent location, good breakfast. It was in a busy area and there is a little bit of noise but not bad enough to keep you awake and the location makes up for it. Rooms are a little small but by paris stands they are fine.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to the positive reviews”
Reviews.Author: MistaMeldrew
Reviews.Content: I booked this place entirely on the basis of itsTripadvisor feedback, and once again, this community has come up trumps!Excellent hotel and one we will certainly use again. Very convenient for CDG Airport as it right next to St Michel RER lineB station. For the same reason, very convenient for the Stade de France which was our reason for visiting Paris.Getting from the airport to central Paris is really easy - use the ticket machines in the railway stations to buy your tickets and speed things up a little.When you arrive at the Saint Michel station, follow signs to exit 'Place St Michel' to come out right next to the hotel. Look just behind the newspaper kiosk. Rooms were spotless and well furnished ,'compact' in typically Parisian style.Reception staff very friendly and helpful. You need to know that it's in a very lively area but it's also only a short stroll from some real history and terrific culture. Truly super location - virtually on the river and just around the corner from Notre Dame. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: sweetprimeras
Reviews.Content: hotel in a great location, rooms spot less as is the bathroom and shower. would stay here again and recommend it to anyone who likes a lively neighbourhood,

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Tootlepip
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 30th Dec - 2nd Jan 2007 and had a brilliant time. The rooms were very clean and the rooms were well arranged given that rooms in Paris can be quite small.
