The staff were very helpful and suggested places to eat and even booked our restaurant for New Years Eve. We had a fantastic meal at Au Jardin and would recommend it to anyone. The restaurant is quite small and intimate and the food and service were both fabulous. The hotel is in a great location for seeing the sights of Paris and with the metro just 100 yards away, you can easily get about.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: smurf76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a weekend break at the end of November and were very happy with our choice. We booked it based on the reviews here and its location. We only had 3 days so its central location was absolutely perfect. It is a fantastic location and right in the heart on the Latin Quarter. The hotel itself is perfectly adequate & clean, grant it the rooms are small, but this is Paris. We found the rooms to be nice and modern, with an excellent shower & bathroom. We requested a room on the 5th floor and to the side and we heard no noise, so perhaps this is a tip when going. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We will definitely return to this gem of a hotel. We went for the breakfast at the boulangerie downstairs which is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel d'Able - Great Location, Good Hotel & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Texas
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 6 nights in Paris - starting Dec 27th and leaving Jan 2, 2007. Hotel d'Albe in the Latin Quarter, 5th Arrrondissement, was a very satisfactory hotel - especially for the average price of $150 Euro a night. It is locate right off Saint Michel near Notre Dame and on the RER B train line from CDG airport. We took the train for about $8.50 Euro versus taxis that can cost over $60 Euro each way. It takes about the same amount of time (45 minutes) using either method. The Hotel is located on the Metro 4 and RER C. Best of all is the easy proximity to the Lovre, Notre Dame, Centre Pompidou and more. The Hotel is located on the Left Bank in an active part of Paris - lots of people walking around the many shops and ethnic resturants. We had two rooms - both on the first floor of the hotel (106 & 145). Both were average sized rooms based on our experience in Paris - double bed, medium walking space, and reasonable bathrooms with tub/showers, average space and hair dryers. Rooms also had mini bars (which we did not use, a small grocery is around the corner) and secure safes. The rooms were very clean and maid service did a good job keeping up with our trafficking in and out during our stay. Room 145 was more modern and located on the interior back side of the hotel making it more quiet - no view from the window and a smaller bathroom. Room 106 was more traditional and ran the length of the hotel - with a front view of street (noisy with the window open, but okay when closed even on New Years Eve) and a second window in the bathroom (helpful if you like fresh air from cross ventilation). Beds were comfortable but a bit firm - rooms included 2 extra pillows. Bathrooms used Grohe fixtures and great water pressure/temperature in the showers and deep tubs. Towels were very light but worked - the bathroom had a warming rack which was nice. We remembered to bring wash cloths since they are not common in Europe. Hotel provided minimum toiletries - soap, bodywash for shampoo, and shoe polish. If you need conditioner and lotion - bring it. The Hotel serves breakfast at $12 Euro a day - which we did not use. Be careful as the charge did show up on our bill -though we had no problem having it removed upon checking out. The entire front desk staff were very helpful - including confirming our dinner reservations during our stay. We treated them to some chocolates purchased at Galleries Lafayette. Overall - we found the Hotel d'Albe to be very satisfactory and would stay here again. The location and rates are very attractive. Access to the museums via Metro or walking was easy and the lively neighborhood was enjoyable. The nearby ATM banking, market, and coffee shops helped meet our every need.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: avided
Reviews.Content: You couldn't find a better location for a Paris hotel. Steps away from the Seine and Notre Dame in a busy district filled with students and fellow travellers. The hotel was very clean, staff very friendly and spoke very good English. Typically the room was quite small but a nice window to open up and watch the world go by. Getting in with a lot of bags was a bit of an effort as you must carry your bags up about 4 steps to get to the elevator and the elevator is only big enough to accomdate one person and one large bag. This would be my only complaint with the possible exception that they charge a lot of money for breakfast. Go to the corner literally 10 steps away and grab a croissant.

Reviews.Title: “It's like staying in Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Travelinggrandma2
Reviews.Content: Lovely lobby, clean rooms and pleasant staff, but......this is a very busy area, noisy at night, and the party noise reaches up into the rooms. Not unpleasant, but I'll choose a quieter spot next time.

Reviews.Title: “great find”
Reviews.Author: gpsdo
Reviews.Content: stayed 2 nights(12/2-3) and thoroughly enjoyed our short stay. reasonable size triple for short stay, with "ensuite" deep tub/shower. elevator. avoid fixed price breakfast-too many cafe's and bakeries within a block. 5min. to notre dame. 10min walk to louve. train station 1block. agree-can be noisy at nite, tho' not on sunday. overall, a great find in st. michel

Reviews.Title: “Another Happy Customer - Great Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Shaken_Bake
Reviews.Content: Another high recommendation for Hotel de l’Albe! L’Albe suited our needs perfectly; a hotel very centrally located, in a scenic, bustling area, steps away from a major Metro stop (St. Michel), clean and friendly. I met some the best hotel staff anywhere, always helpful and willing to chat. The rooms are small but very clean and nicely decorated, including a flat screen TV, large armoire and minibar. The lobby is bright and roomy. Despite the heavy windows, the noise from the streets below does creep in late on weekends and with the early garbage pickup, but being on a higher floor would mitigate that (and provide a nice view of the Seine or Notre Dame). Breakfast was pricey (12E) but you didn’t have to take it or even reserve in advance, just show up. The bakery next door provided coffee and croissant much cheaper. We got a lower rate through Active Hotels, compared to the hotel’s posted Internet rate. We had absolutely no problem with the reservation or rate being honored by the hotel. They even have a communal laptop with wireless you can borrow, and 5E network access cards for 45 minutes online. I love this place and would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Return Visit - Has gotten more expensive tho”
Reviews.Author: nairb356
Reviews.Content: returned for Weekend of Retremobile exhibition Renovations have been completed, still excellent but its quite pricey now IMO Will stay again because the location is impossible to beat

Reviews.Title: “Just back and loved it”
Reviews.Author: mazdalaydee
Reviews.Content: Just back tonight after spending 5 nights in Paris. Its our first time staying in Paris - have driven through and been through on the train but never actually stopped there. We just loved Paris and thought the Albe was excellent value . Our room was recently re-furbished so everything was fairly new and pristine. We were in a room with 3 beds and 2 flat screen TV's!! It was bigger than I had expected. The bathroom was a good size and had 2 washbasins. A bath with an over the bath shower. The sheets and towels were changed daily. After long days walk the streets of Paris it was great to have a lovely soak in the bath, the shower was also good. The hairdryer wasn't the usual slow hotel type and this was great given that I had forgotten to take mine. There was a free in room safe and a minibar. The hotel staff were very welcoming and pleasant. The room spotlessly clean and well presented. Having read about the breadshop downstairs we decided to skip the 12Euro hotel breakfast and opt for there. This saved us quite a lot over the time we were there. True it is in a very touristy area and if you had had your windows open it may have been a little noisy. However, we slept like logs every night. After a hard days sightseeing, museums and art galleries we were so pleased that we could just walk out of the door and find so many restuarants. We would definately return tp Paris and would definately stay at the Albe. A great little spot that is so easy to get to from the airport, lots of eating places within minutes, easy access to all the main sights and friendly/helpful staff. Missing it already.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and ideal base for exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: grandtour
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights and found it suited our needs completely. The room had everything we needed and the bathroom was spotless. We were on the sixth floor on the Rue de la Huchette side so the view from our window was of the towers of Notre Dame - they looked great at all times of day but my favourite was early morning. The hotel is a few steps from the Metro and RER stops so all of Paris is easily accessible but the Latin Quarter is very interesting in its own right and full of good places to eat and drink. Notre Dame, the Louvre, the Sorbonne and Cluny museum (to name just a few attractions) are within easy walking distance as is the Siene for boat trips or strolls on the banks. I recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to be in a lively part of Paris. (We were never bothered by noise from outside the hotel at any time - closing the windows really does work)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !”
Reviews.Author: AudnAde
Reviews.Content: Spent some time searching on line before booking Hotel d'Albe, mainly based on TripAdvisor reviews. Spent 4 nights in October, and what a fantastic place! Made sure we had a room (double) on the 5th floor at the front, had a small balcony & superb views. The room wasn't huge, but perfectly comfortable & spotlessly clean. The staff were very helpful & polite (they all speak perfect English, but it's fun trying out your French - very basic in my case - & I'm sure they appreciate the effort). Breakfast isn't the cheapest, but it's good quality an endless buffet, so you can eat as much as you want & stoke up for the day. It's optional anyway, so you can always eat out. The Latin Quarter is really buzzing & it was so nice not to have to walk miles after an evening out. We're definitely going to visit Paris again, & will certainly stay at the Hotel d'Albe again, couldn't wish for better at the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Staffs-couple
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel direct after reading reviews on trip advisor. We were not disappointed. The hotel is in one of the best locations in Paris for bars and restaurants. Its ideal after a days sightseeing to have everything you need on the doorstep and not have to wander for miles for somewhere to eat. You are spoilt for choice deciding which restaurant to go for! Some are better value than others, usually the ones that aren't trying to tout for business when you walk past. The hotel itself was very clean, if not a bit basic. However the good location more than made up for any lack of facilities. If you don't intend to spend much time in your room this would be the ideal hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: vanuk
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about Hotel D'Able. Both my boyfriend and I extensively researched hotels in Paris (it was our first time there), reading review after review , but finally decided Hotel D'Albe. And, I'm so glad we did! Location: the Latin Quarter is the perfect place to stay -young and old. It's definitely the livlier of the areas, but not unbearable by any means. Close to multiple metros and great location should you choose to venture off and walk around. Staff: totally great. They even went out of their way to provide me with an international adapter for my hair straightener after realizing the one I brought didn't work. That would've put a damper on my whole trip! Room: Yes, it was on the smaller side - but that's Europe for you. It was still spacious enough for the two of us. The bed was comfortable; although, I'm unsure as to why we got a room with one double and one single bed. The bathroom was awesome! Super clean and great shower pressure! After booking on Travelocity, my boyfriend called ahead to request a room with a balcony. Adds a wonderful touch. When going to Paris next, will consider staying there agin (unless we want to try out another area, but from what we saw sightseeing, we loved the Latin Quarter!). Consider it highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Midlands-Family
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay at Hotel D'Albe and would thoroughly recommend it. Great location - particularly welcome after struggling on the Metro with two suitcases. We stayed in Room 211 which has the balcony at the front of the hotel where the D'Albe sign is. We were able to stand on the small balcony, sip a glass of wine and soak up the atmosphere of the hustle and bustle below. However, once the windows were shut the double glazing did its job and we slept well on both nights. We received a warm welcome at reception and they did highlight that breakfast was not included in the price (unlike previous reviews). Skip breakfast at the hotel and eat at the cafe next door. Plenty of local restaurants with a wide choice of culinary styles. The rooms were small but clean and were ideal for City Centre touring. The hotel is well situated for visiting the city. Notre Dame is within walking distance, the Metro is close at hand and Open Top bus tours and River trips are available close by. Would recommend this hotel as great value for money. Yes the rooms are "compact and bijou" but don't stay in your room - there's a wonderful city out there to explore. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Good Location”
Reviews.Author: AileenS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights with our 5 year old daughter. We had a triple room which was small but adequate and very clean. The room had a minibar which was great for storing drinks / snacks for our daughter. The hotel was a great base to explore Paris and was reasonably priced. We booked through expedia and got breakfast included in the rate. The area is quite lively but we were not bothered by any street noise. This is not somewhere to stay if you are looking for a hotel with atmosphere as there is no hotel bar or restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Would happily stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: aliballi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. Yes the rooms are small but this is Paris and this being my 4th trip I knew to expect this. The room was very clean, the bathroom was very clean. The location is perfect for doing all you want to do in Paris (Metro stop at Place St Michel) is just round the corner. As for noise, we were on the 6th floor and didn't hear anything from the street when we closed the window. I have been disappointed by Paris hotels before and this is the first that I've stayed in that I would happily go back to or recommend to someone else. You don't go to Paris to spend your time i a hotel room so what more do you want!!!

Reviews.Title: “Average rooms and loud location!”
Reviews.Author: savvytraveler
Reviews.Content: We prepaid for 2 rooms with whatif at a slightly lower rate than the direct hotel's booking rates. The D'able was fully booked our first nite in Paris so we stayed at the K & K Hotel the one night, which was wonderful !! The triple was bigger than 2 rooms put together at the D'albe plus the fully equipped marble bathroom was huge and the down beds very comfortable. But since we prepaid and couldn't cancel, we moved and regretted it!! As the D'Albe hotel was full the first nite, we ended up on the 2nd floor and our daughter on the 5th floor. The room (102, I think) was tiny and not very well equipped. We wanted non-smoking but settled for opening the window. The partying noise outside went all thru the night and closing the window didn't help much. We moved to a smaller room the next nite to the 5th floor that was fairly quiet with the window closed and the noises outside subsided by 2 AM. for the next 3 nights. The bathrooms are tiny and the foam pillows, cheap sheets and rough blankets were really disappointing after the K & K. Otherwise the hotel was clean and the people polite, but as said in a previous review "nothing special." We also preferred the more central location of the K & K and their direct booking special price included a wonderful breakfast.!

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel”
Reviews.Author: mwilkins
Reviews.Content: We needed somewhere for a couple of nights in Paris (2 adults and a 6 year old) and were not disappointed. The hotel is a great 3 star hotel; clean, friendly, and perfectly placed close to Notre Dame. It has no bar or restaurant (except for breakfast) but this doesn't matter because it is surrounded by bars and restaurants. We'll be back the next time we have a short stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaSoul
Reviews.Content: Okay, so I wasn't planning on ever really leaving a review about this hotel but here I am looking for another hotel in Paris for our stay this year. Once I saw the raving reviews about this hotel again I had to give my honest opinion so people don't make the same mistake that we did. Needless to say we aren't staying here again. I stayed in this hotel with my husband and son for one night last year on our way to Africa. We chose this hotel based on the reviews in Trip Advisor. I have to say that we were quite disappointed with our room. We had a triple room and of course it was small no surprise there but it was the basics. The staff was very nice and the breakfast was okay. I suppose if you are looking for a no frills budget hotel in the middle of bustling activity, than this place is for you. The location is good, in the heart of the Latin Quarter and minutes from Notre Dame. Yes , the lobby may look nice in the pictures but I have learned that you can't judge a hotel by it's lobby. I am by no means overly critical or snobbish I just expected more I guess. I suppose you get what you pay for and if you want a half way decent room in Paris than you have to pay!!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: tichelle77
Reviews.Content: Overall, we enjoyed our stay at this hotel. First, the bad -- we read a number of reviews that emphasized soundproof windows; however, the noise from the street still penetrates. Some noises come through more loudly than others, such as, garbage trucks (every other morning at 5 am), police sirens, screaming, shouting, group singing, etc...and a lot of this goes on in the Latin Quarter until about 2-3 a.m. With that said, the windows do keep out approximately 70% of the noise. Without the double thickness, the location would be unbearable. Regarding the individuals at the front desk, some were more pleasant than others. The last morning of our stay, we had an upstairs neighbor that literally stomped around above us making it impossible to sleep (our ceiling was shaking). When I called the front desk at 5:30 am, the attendant stated that she would look into it. Over 30 minutes later, the noise hadn't stopped so I called again only to have her say that she hadn't called the individual yet and that she had departures to take care of. One hour later, the noise had still not subsided, and I called a third time only to have her say that she was checking into it. When we checked out 3.5 hours later, we found out from her that she NEVER contacted the individual above us, and she got angry that we couldn't understand why (the noise stopped approx. 30 minutes before we checked out). She informed me that she had done all she could do and was supposed to do. Also, like too many hotels, the comforters/bedspreads and blankets had not been washed prior to our arrival. We found hair and spots on the bedding. The good news is that the room, with the exception of the blankets and comforters, was very clean. Even though it was small, we had enough space to navigate and store our very large duffel bags/suitcases and other carry-on size bags. The rooom was small, but designed to be very efficient in managing the lack of space. The bathroom was probably the best feature of the room. It was very clean and the shower was wonderful. The beds were comfortable to sleep in and the heating/air conditioning unit was working very nicely. Lastly, the location is priceless, being located between two metro stops, St. Michel and Cluny-Sorbonne. The RER is accessible from both, which makes it amazingly convenient coming to an from the airport let alone any other location in Paris and the suburbs. The bakery/patisserie located beneath the hotel serverd delicious breads, crepes, and coffee. The bonus was having a Haagen-Dazs a stone's through from the hotel. However, I wouldn't advise eating too often in the Latin Quarter because the food really wasn't that great, but you do get what you pay for and most of it was very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: demone714
Reviews.Content: just came back from Paris... and LOVED the D'Albe. As posted in other reviews, it truly is all about the location. Yes, the rooms were def on the smaller side, but everything was very clean. the staff was helpful. and were for the most part, friendly. i recommend this hotel for people who do not intend on spending any time in it (even though it was comfortable). the price was very fair for paris. however, i do not recommend this hotel for people who want a large room, or a fancy lobby, as there is just a small desk. this is definitely not a 5-star hotel. the location is very close to Notre Dame and Saint Chapelle. It's in the heart of the latin quarter, which is very touristy... (i recommend not eating dinner here, as the food is much better in the surrounding blocks). it can get a bit loud if you're facing the street. didn't bother us, as we stayed out late, but if you go to sleep before 12 and you have a problem with even the slightest bit of noise, request a room facing the back. we were on the 5th floor, and had a little balcony, which provided a little bit of views. Also, try to book directly with the hotels website... Exclusive-hotels, saved almost $30 a night booking directly through them. also, make sure you let them know whether or not you want the breakfast. it's 12 euro a person, which was definitely too expensive for us, as there is a little bakery downstairs where you can get croissant and coffee for 2 for 7 euro. overall, loved this hotel, and i'm recommending it to everyone i know :)

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Lhoppy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a few days in Paris staying at this excellent establishment - couldn't fault it. Only a few steps from the metro/RER and just about everything else on the doorstep. Although I'd read Trip Advisor reviews before booking through Expedia I was pleased to find it was all true. Brilliant holiday and when I return to Paris, I shall certainly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but that is about it.”
Reviews.Author: EMCLC
Reviews.Content: I must say I only booked this hotel based on reviews from trip advisor and was actually dissapointed. The room albeit very clean was in fact very small and I did not find the reception staff very helpfull. We asked the receptionist for help confirming an excursion by phone and she wouldn't. The location is good if you wish to be in the heart of the latin quarter but quite a distance from the major sights of Eiffel Tower etc.

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week in early September 2006 at the Hotel D'Albe located in the Latin Quarter. The location is superb--close to the Metro, about a 5 minute walk from Notre Dame and about a 20 minute walk to the Louvre. There are many good restaurants within the neighborhood and in particular, an excellent Salon de The right next door with wonderful croissants, pastries and sandwiches. Although the hotel is located right in the heart of the Latin Quarter, the double pane windows and heavy curtains ensure privacy and quiet. The rooms and bathroom were small, but extremely clean. The staff at the front desk were without exception friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - be careful of paying for breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: amiprice
Reviews.Content: This is an excellently-located hotel right by the St Michel metro stop. Very convenient to all train stations and any tourist attraction. Right by a ton of restaurants and a Starbucks. I've been to Paris three times and this location was by far the best. The room was comfortable, small by US standards but certainly average/good by European standards. We needed a triple, so we had one double bed and one single. The view out of our window was of the St Michel corner right by the Metro. Beds were comfy and there were extra pillows. EXCELLENT bathroom - we had been to four other hotels by the time we reached Paris and I loved all of them but this was by far the best bathroom/shower The elevator is small and slow, typical Paris, but we were on the 6th floor so we waited rather than taking the stairs. Now, here we are at my big problem with this place (and the reason I gave 4 instead of 5 stars). When we checked in, we were told that breakfast was served in the room downstairs. So naturally, each morning we ate breakfast in the room downstairs. Anyone traveling to Europe knows that some hotels have breakfast included and some do not. We assumed by the way we were checked in that it was included. It wasn't and it was 12 euros a piece! At checkout, I was furious but the manager did nothing to assuage my frustration. This irritated me more than the breakfast itself. I am not saying that the hotel advertised falsely. There is a small sign next to the check in counter and also it is printed on their website. However, they really should mention it at check-in as well in order to diffuse situations like this.
